title: Cost Accountant (Temporary)
description:
Job Overview – Cost Accountant (Temporary):

Join our client's team in Los Angeles, CA, as a Cost Accountant, playing a key role in managing and analyzing the financial aspects of food manufacturing processes. In this temporary role, reporting to the plant controller, you’ll focus on accurate cost reporting, enhancing operational efficiency, and supporting strategic financial decisions.

Compensation: $25 - $30/hour

Location: Los Angeles, CA

Schedule: Monday to Friday (In-Office)

Responsibilities as the Cost Accountant (Temporary):
• Cost Management: Maintain standard costs for raw materials, labor, and overhead, analyzing production costs and conducting variance analysis to identify and address discrepancies.
• Reporting & Analysis: Prepare cost reports, reconcile inventory discrepancies, and provide actionable insights to enhance cost efficiency.
• Inventory Oversight: Lead inventory cycle counts and audits, manage inventory transactions at the plant and 3PL, and ensure daily production postings are accurate.
• Budgeting & Forecasting: Contribute to annual budget preparation, periodic forecasts, and manufacturing variance analysis.
• Collaboration: Work with production and supply chain teams to resolve cost-related issues and support new product development initiatives.
• Internal Controls: Ensure compliance with financial policies, internal controls, and perform balance sheet reconciliations.

Qualifications for the Cost Accountant (Temporary):
• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
• Experience: At least 3 years of Cost Accounting experience, preferably in a food manufacturing environment.
• Skills: Strong analytical, problem-solving, communication, and organizational abilities, with proven success working independently and collaboratively.
• Technical Proficiency: Advanced Excel skills and experience with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, or JDE); familiarity with GAAP standards is required.
• Attributes: Strong understanding of operational excellence principles and a track record of identifying trends and implementing efficiency improvements.

Application Notice: Qualified candidates will be contacted within 2 business days of application. If an applicant does not meet the above criteria, Atlantic Group will keep your resume on file for future opportunities and may contact you for further discussion.

Job description

Job Summary

OfficeKEY is looking for a knowledgeable and detail-oriented Accountant to join our finance team. The successful candidate will manage financial records, ensure timely processing of transactions, and provide insights through financial analysis. This role will require a solid understanding of accounting principles and practices, proficiency with accounting software, and strong analytical skills.

Responsibilities

Manage the day-to-day accounting operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger entries.

Prepare monthly financial statements, reports, and analysis for management.

Reconcile bank and investment accounts to ensure accurate financial reporting.

Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with internal controls and financial regulations.

Assist in budgeting and forecasting processes.

Prepare and file annual tax returns and ensure compliance with tax regulations.

Collaborate with external auditors and provide necessary documentation during audits.

Maintain proper documentation for all financial transactions and prepare supporting schedules for the financial statements.

Stay updated with accounting regulations and best practices.

Experience

Proven experience as an Accountant or similar role.

Familiarity with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, or similar platforms) is preferred.

Understanding of accounting principles and procedures.

Skills

Strong attention to detail and accuracy.

title: Sr Accountant
description:
Work Schedule
Standard (Mon-Fri)

Environmental Conditions
Office

Job Description

Thermo Fisher Scientific, Inc.’s Transplant Diagnostics business ("TDX") is seeking a knowledgeable and dynamic Sr Accountant to join our team in West Hills, CA.

About the Team:

The TDX Controllership team owns core accounting responsibilities, partners with key partners to ensure accurate and timely financial information is available to drive senior leadership decisions, and uses its unique access to many parts of the business to drive operational enhancement opportunity.

The successful candidate will partner with Accounting, Finance, Operations, and Business Management teams to support successful month-end closes, solicit and apply relevant financial and operational information impacting financial reporting, and support special projects and process improvements. This role will be involved in Accounting processes standardizations, Financial reconciliations (P&L variances and Balance Sheet recons), day-to-day Accounts Receivable/ Revenue related tasks, tax compliance, and support during internal/external audit activities.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

• Performing diverse accounting close activities as assigned, including: Journal Entries, GL Account Reconciliation prep, clearance of reconciling items.

• Review of certain intercompany transactions as pertaining to direct materials purchases, in support of maintaining clean GR/IR accounting.

• Fixed Asset Management – Assist business partners and Finance team in: CAR (Capital Appropriation Request) generation and routing for approval, application of Accounting Policy towards CAPEX and OpEx spend, creation of Asset Shells, and review of Fixed Asset reconciliation and roll-forward schedules to ensure accuracy in Fixed Assets accounting and timely progress towards CIP completion.

• Revenue Recognition – Support compliance with ASC 606 and application of internal Accounting Policy, key spreadsheets, FOB Analysis, and post accrued/ deferred revenue aligned with company revenue recognition policy.

• Support monthly and quarterly Sales and Use Tax filings.

• Drive compliance with internal Procument and Sales procedures.

• Support management reporting package and performing financial statement analyses, and documenting meaningful explanations for fluctuations for management and auditors.

• Participation in external and internal audits.

• Be a key business partner to business operations leaders to meet financial goals.

• Analyze metrics, trends, and performance and bring insights to division leadership team.

Minimum Qualifications:

• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or related field.

• 6+ years of work experience in Accounting or Finance, ideally with exposure to Accounts Receivable and Procurement, Revenue, Intercompany, Royalties and/or Sales Tax.

• Strong understanding of current US GAAP required, specifically Revenue Recognition.

• Strong SAP systems experience preferred.

• Knowledge of standard finance systems (e.g. SAP, Hyperion, HFM, CMR, Oracle, Blackline).

• Intermediate-Advanced Skills in Microsoft suite, including: Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.

• Thrives in a fast-paced, high impact and dynamic environment.

• Comfortable communicating with senior management.

• Proactiveness in problem solving, trouble shooting, and root cause and ad-hoc analyses.

• Strong attention to detail with an ability to work well with others.

• Strong analytical or financial modeling skills.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, religion, color, national or ethnic origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, genetic information, veteran status, age or disability status.

Schedule - 8am - 5pm M-F; Onsite

Please Note- Interested candidates should apply directly through our careers page. Applications from recruitment agencies or third-party recruiters will not be considered.

Compensation and Benefits
The salary range estimated for this position based in California is $103,100.00–$160,000.00.

This position may also be eligible to receive a variable annual bonus based on company, team, and/or individual performance results in accordance with company policy. We offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package that our U.S. colleagues and their families can count on, which includes:
• A choice of national medical and dental plans, and a national vision plan, including health incentive programs
• Employee assistance and family support programs, including commuter benefits and tuition reimbursement
• At least 120 hours paid time off (PTO), 10 paid holidays annually, paid parental leave (3 weeks for bonding and 8 weeks for caregiver leave), accident and life insurance, and short- and long-term disability in accordance with company policy
• Retirement and savings programs, such as our competitive 401(k) U.S. retirement savings plan
• Employees’ Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offers eligible colleagues the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount

For more information on our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.thermofisher.com/global/en/total-rewards

title: Staff Accountant
description:
Position Overview:

We’re Hiring: Staff Accountant!

Location: Garden Grove, CA

Job Type: Full-Time M-F (40 hours/Week)

Pay rate: $67,000/yr - $71,000/yr

What We Offer:
• Comprehensive health benefits package
• HSA & FSA Accounts
• Group Life, Voluntary Life & AD&D
• STD, LTD, Accident, & Critical Illness
• Employee Assistance Program
• Travel Protection
• PTO & Sick Time

Job Summary: We are seeking a highly dependable. motivated, and detail-oriented Staff Accountant to join our accounting team. This individual will support day-to-day accounting operations, assist in the month-end close process, and help ensure financial accuracy and compliance across all reporting. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in accounting principles, excellent organizational skills, and a proactive attitude toward learning and cross-functional collaboration.

What You’ll Do:

General Accounting Duties & Responsibilities:
• Responsible for full-cycle AR process including billing, collections and payment application
• Support the month-end and year-end close process and follows accounting procedures
• Record bank and credit card transactions in a timely manner
• Performs timely and accurate reconciliations of bank accounts and credit cards statements
• Reconcile key balance sheet accounts including AP, AR and accrual accounts
• Identify and resolve discrepancies promptly
• Maintain ASC 842 lease accounting schedules
• Post and review journal entries with appropriate supporting documentation
• Maintain accurate schedules for prepaids, fixed assets and accruals and ensures proper monthly depreciation and amortization expense
• Assists in preparing financial statements and management reports
• Ensures accurate data entry and timely processing of transactions
• Work effectively with both internal and external stakeholders
• Participates in process improvements, SOP documentation, and internal control enhancements
• Performs other duties as assigned

What You’ll Need:
• B.A. or B.S. degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field is preferred
• Minimum of four to six years of accounting experience
• Strong working knowledge of QuickBooks Online (QBO)
• Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
• Excellent analytical, organizational, and time-management skills
• Strong understanding or accrual accounting and GAAP principles
• Effective verbal and written communication abilities
• Detail oriented mindset with strong organizational skills
• Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines
• Experience working with Bill.com a plus but not required

Physical Demands:
• Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
• Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times

About Us: We are a premier testing lab in the natural medicines and natural products sector. Family-run for 28 years, and with hundreds of clients worldwide, we’re in rapid growth mode managing many exciting changes. We’ve carefully nurtured an outstanding people- and family-first culture that is
positive, supportive, and highly ethical.

Apply today to join the Alkemist Labs team!

Pay Range: USD $67,000.00 - USD $71,000.00 /Hr.

title: Accountant
description:
Job Title: Staff Accountant

Location: Rancho Dominguez, CA

Pay Rate: $28–$33/hour (Based on Experience)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Position Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Staff Accountant to join our accounting team in Rancho Dominguez, CA. This role supports payroll processing, accounts payable/receivable, bank reconciliations, and financial recordkeeping. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, demonstrate strong analytical skills, and maintain the accuracy and integrity of financial data.

Key Responsibilities:

Payroll:
• Process weekly payroll and generate internal payroll reports.
• Post payroll entries to the general ledger and reconcile any discrepancies.
• Manage employee records and handle HR/payroll-related issues including benefits administration.
• Maintain up-to-date and organized personnel files.

Accounts Payable & Receivable:
• Upload check runs to Wells Fargo Positive Pay and monitor fraud alerts.
• Assist in processing vendor invoices and issuing payments.
• Support accounts receivable by preparing and depositing customer payments.
• Provide backup support across AP and AR functions as needed.

Bank Reconciliation:
• Monitor daily cash disbursements and banking activity.
• Complete monthly bank reconciliations by the 10th of the following month.
• Investigate and resolve discrepancies to ensure accuracy.

General Accounting & Reporting:
• Prepare and post monthly, quarterly, and year-end journal entries.
• Maintain intercompany reconciliations and financial reports.
• Reconcile credit card statements and ensure proper recording.
• Prepare and post accruals to align with proper accounting periods.
• Audit and reconcile inventory/receiving reports to the general ledger.
• Support month-end and quarter-end closings in collaboration with the Controller.
• Maintain supporting schedules and reconcile balance sheet accounts.

Audit Support:
• Assist with external audits by providing requested documentation and meeting audit timelines.
• Work closely with the Controller to ensure compliance and accurate reporting.

Qualifications:
• 2–4 years of accounting experience preferred.
• Strong knowledge of GAAP and accounting procedures.
• Experience with payroll and general ledger accounting.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience with accounting software preferred.
• High attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.
• Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.

title: Senior Corporate Accountant
description:
Use our easy apply form to send your application to David Hyon, the Jobot Pro hosting this job. Compensation Based on Experience.

Senior Corporate Accountant

$95000 - $125000 per year | Beverly Hills, CA | On-Site | Permanent

Senior Corporate Accountant, Hybrid, Public accountant, Beverly Hills, Real Estate, reply to David.Hyon@jobot.com

A bit about us:

We are Real Estate Development Company.

Why join us?

• Great team and culture
• Public Company with growth potential
• Hybrid work schedule
• Beautiful Office in Beverly Hills
• Great Benefits and Compensation

Job Details

Job Details:

We are currently seeking a dynamic, detail-oriented, and experienced Permanent Senior Corporate Accountant to join our team in the Real Estate industry. This role will offer an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment, where your expertise and skills will be valued and utilized to drive the financial success of our organization. The ideal candidate will have a solid background in public accounting, with a strong emphasis on month-end close, SEC reporting, 10K and 10Q preparation, balance sheet reconciliation, consolidations, and reporting.

Responsibilities:

As a Senior Corporate Accountant, you will be responsible for:

1. Overseeing and managing the entire month-end close process, ensuring all financial data is accurate and timely.
2. Preparing and submitting SEC reports, including 10K and 10Q filings.
3. Conducting balance sheet reconciliations and maintaining accurate financial records.
4. Assisting with the preparation of annual budgets and financial forecasts.
5. Ensuring compliance with all financial regulations and standards.
6. Coordinating with internal and external auditors to provide necessary documentation and answer queries.
7. Leading and executing the consolidation and financial reporting processes.
8. Participating in special projects and performing ad-hoc financial analyses as required.

Qualifications:

To be considered for this role, you must have:

1. A Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field. An MBA or CPA is highly preferred.
2. A minimum of 3 years of experience in a corporate accounting role, preferably within the Real Estate industry.
3. Proven experience in public accounting, with a strong understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting.
4. Extensive knowledge and experience in month-end close, SEC reporting, 10K and 10Q preparation, and balance sheet reconciliation.
5. Demonstrated experience in consolidations and financial reporting.
6. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.
7. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization.
8. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced Excel skills. Knowledge of accounting software is a plus.
9. Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines, while maintaining a high level of professionalism and integrity.

Join our team and take the next step in your accounting career! This role offers an excellent opportunity for professional growth and development, with the chance to make a significant impact on our company's financial performance. Apply today!

We provide an inclusive work environment that celebrates diversity and all qualified candidates receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Sponsored Projects Accountant 2
description:
Sponsored Projects Accountant 2

University of California Los Angeles

Special Instructions to Applicants

Please upload your cover letter and resume combined

Department Summary

The Office of Extramural Fund Management (EFM) is a part of the Office of Research Administration (ORA) which supports the UCLA research program by providing leadership, professional guidance and administrative services to faculty, department administrators, and students. Under the direction of the Accountant 4-Supervisor in EFM, the Accountant II will serve as a team member of the Fund Management Accountant staff.
Position Summary

The incumbent ensures financial stewardship of sponsored funds. Analyze and review expenditures, identify compliance policy violations, communicate concerns and issues to campus department personnel, facilitate resolution of outstanding issues, and prepare complex financial reports and invoices per university, sponsor and federal guidelines. Review and validate the establishment of contract and grants in the award management and the University's financial systems, keep abreast of changing agency regulatory requirements, and offer guidance to the campus research community surrounding financial management of contract and grants. *Remote Work Offered
• *Please upload your cover letter and resume combined

Salary & Compensation
• UCLA provides a full pay range. Actual salary offers consider factors, including budget, prior experience, skills, knowledge, abilities, education, licensure and certifications, and other business considerations. Salary offers at the top of the range are not common. Visit UC Benefit package to discover benefits that start on day one, and UC Total Compensation Estimator to calculate the total compensation value with benefits.
Qualifications
• Demonstrated competence in the use of spreadsheet and database software in financial analysis, fiscal management and financial reports. (Required)
• Ability to perform complex financial analysis and customized reporting. (Required)
• Ability to manage significant volume of transactions. (Required)
• Thorough knowledge of applicable compliance requirements related to use of human or animal subjects in research, financial conflict of interest, biosafety, etc. (Required)
• Maintains current knowledge of compliance regulations in all areas of research administration. (Required)
• Demonstrated knowledge of generally accepted accounting, fiscal and reporting principles. (Required)
• Strong writing skills in a variety of styles to draft persuasive text for a variety of audiences while ensuring adherence to funding sponsor's guidelines. (Required)
• Demonstrated knowledge of effective grant funding processes, procedures and techniques (Required)
• Ability to maintain independent judgment; strong organization and communication skills; and a customer service focus across broad and diverse subject areas. (Required)
• Ability to perform complex financial analysis and customized reporting. (Required)
• Ability to manage significant volume of transactions. (Required)
Education, Licenses, Certifications & Personal Affiliations
• Bachelor's Degree Bachelor's degree in related area and / equivalent experience / training (Required) Or
Special Conditions for Employment
• Background Check: Continued employment is contingent upon the completion of a satisfactory background investigation.
• Live Scan Background Check: A Live Scan background check must be completed prior to the start of employment.
Schedule

Mon - Fri, 8:00am - 5:00pm Pacific Standard

99-Policy Covered

title: Jr Accountant - Accounts Payable
description:
Junior Accountant – Accounts Payable

Location: Carson (Fully Onsite)

Pay: $24-26/hour (based on experience)

Non-Profit Organization

Contract to Hire

Bachelor’s Degree Required

Accounting, Typing, and Excel assessment will be given

Role Overview:

Seeking a detail-oriented accounting professional to support accounts payable operations, financial reporting, and compliance tasks within a non-profit setting.

Key Responsibilities:

Accounts Payable:
• Process high-volume AP transactions across multiple departments.
• Maintain and update vendor records, ensuring compliance with W9 & 1099 requirements.
• Review and code invoices for accuracy and proper account allocation.
• Ensure all financial transactions follow company policies and procedures.
• Track sales tax records for quarterly reporting.
• Generate payments, prepare supporting documentation, and handle check processing.
• Investigate and resolve AP discrepancies and outstanding payments.
• Serve as the primary contact for AP-related inquiries.
• Standardize reimbursement and petty cash procedures across units.
• Organize and maintain voucher records and supporting documents.
• Perform monthly AP aging report reconciliations.
• Process corporate credit card expenses, reimbursements, and petty cash transactions.
• Assist with month-end and year-end closing procedures.
• Prepare journal entries for prepayments, accruals, and expense allocations.
• Reconcile balance sheet accounts related to AP.
• Process journal entries for credit card transactions and cost distributions.
• Support audits with AP documentation and reporting.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (required).
• Experience in accounts payable, general ledger reconciliations, and financial reporting.
• Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.
• Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with different teams.

title: Senior Accountant (Electric Utility)
description:
The City of Moreno Valley seeks a highly motivated, energetic, individual
to join a high-performing team!
There is currently one (1) vacancy in the Financial & Management Services Department.

A 2% base salary increase is scheduled to become effective with the first full pay period that begins after July 1, 2025.

Recruitment may be used to establish an eligibility list for future vacancies.
This recruitment may close at anytime without any notice.

THE POSITION
The Senior Accountant plays a vital role in maintaining the City's financial integrity by overseeing complex accounting functions, financial analysis, and budgetary operations. This position is responsible for ensuring compliance with governmental accounting standards, preparing financial reports, conducting audits, and providing insightful fiscal analysis to support decision-making.

Serving as an experienced financial resource within the organization, the Senior Accountant leads cross-functional financial projects, guides accounting staff, and works closely with department heads to streamline financial operations. Their expertise ensures accurate financial reporting, strategic budget management, and effective administration of special fund accounts.

This position also plays a key role in supporting the Moreno Valley Utility Division, ensuring the proper tracking of revenues, expenditures, and debt obligations related to municipal utilities.

Find additional information in the Senior Accountant job description.

IDEAL CANDIDATE
The ideal candidate is a detail-driven finance professional with a strong background in governmental accounting, budget management, and financial reporting. They excel in problem-solving, project leadership, and cross-functional collaboration, effectively communicating complex financial concepts while ensuring accuracy and efficiency in fiscal operations. Additionally, they thrive in a fast-paced environment, balancing multiple priorities with precision and efficiency. Knowledge of utility financial management is highly desirable, as the role involves overseeing financial operations related to municipal utilities.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
A bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, business administration or a closely related field; OR, equivalent related work experience;AND
A minimum of four (4) years of progressively responsible professional accounting experience, preferably in a City or governmental agency.

DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS
Senior Accountant is the advanced professional journey-level classification of the finance/accounting job family that serves as an experienced resource to City managers and staff. This class performs professional accounting and financial work ranging from moderate difficulty to complex. Assignments require the use of professional judgment and a thorough knowledge of accounting principles and financial management practices.

A Senior Accountant may be assigned lead responsibility for cross-functional projects and may guide the work of lower-level professional and technical accounting staff.

Senior Accountant is distinguished from Accountant in that employees in the former class perform more complex accounting and analyses of greater significance and impact on the operations and management of the City.

THE SELECTION PROCESS

Applicants possessing the MOST DESIRABLE qualifications at each level, based on a screening of required application materials, including the completed Supplemental Questionnaire, will be invited to continue in the selection process.

The City of Moreno Valley prioritizes and is committed to continuously providing a workplace where equal employment opportunity is afforded to all people. As part of this commitment, The City of Moreno Valley will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations.

If reasonable accommodations are needed to participate in the interview process, please contact Human Resources at hr@moval.org or (951) 413-3045.

title: Accountant
description:
Description:
• The Accountant will prepare financial reports to track the organization’s assets, liabilities, profit and loss, tax liabilities, and other related financial activities.

Requirements:
• Maintained Fixed assets and depreciation schedules and create journal entries accordingly.
• Prepare and file monthly and quarterly sales, use tax, and remit payments.
• Prepare and file the 571 Business Property Statement form and remit periodic property tax payments.
• CA Environmental fees as required.
• Maintain Business License renewal and new applications.
• Petty Cash disbursements, maintenance, and reconciliation.
• Manage companywide mail daily
• Ad Hoc projects assigned

Accounts Receivable
• Gathering and sorting documents and related information and providing as needed to customers, management, or peers i.e. Statements, invoices, work orders, and invoice amendments.
• Assist in Securing Customer P.O. communication with Customer Service
• Obtains revenue by verifying transaction information, computing charges, and refunds, and preparing and mailing invoices.
• Verifies accounts by reconciling aging statements, customer transactions, credit holds, and payment plan arrangements if needed.
• Maintain customer database record update i.e. customer contacts, invoice recipients, phone numbers, email addresses, physical addresses, etc.
• Collects revenue by reminding delinquent accounts, and notifying customers of insufficient payments through weekly e-mails and daily phone calls
• Process Credit Card Payments
• Collect supporting documents for ACH payments
• Address customer complaints and issues, and work with the Service department to investigate and resolve them.
• Participate in weekly AR meetings and provide reporting.

Month end and Yearend Close
• Maintain accounting ledgers by posting journal entry transactions.
• Maintains financial security by following internal accounting controls and ensuring the highest standards and practices.
• Maintaining the general ledger by posting financial transaction
• Maintains financial historical records by record-keeping accounting documents.
• Account reconciliations on accounts as needed.
• Other admin duties, open/close month as necessary, chart of account maintenance additions and deletions.
• Assist in Financial statement preparations.
• Sales and Use Tax preparation (experience is a must)

Required Skills/Abilities:
• Extensive knowledge of general financial accounting and cost accounting
• Understanding of and ability to adhere to generally accepted accounting principles.
• Highly proficient with accounting software.
• Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Expert in Microsoft Office Suite or similar software.

Education and Experience:
• Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related discipline required.
• Three to five years of accounting experience is required.

Physical Requirements:
• Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
• Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at a time.

Alliance Industrial Refrigeration is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, and disability or veteran status. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request (Alliance is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request).

title: Accountant - Houston, TX or Sunnyvale, CA
description:
Imagine a company that recognizes excellence in not only the products it sells, but also in its employees. R.S. Hughes Company, Inc. is that company. We hold ourselves to the highest standards of quality and professionalism — and we treat our employees like the valuable assets they are.

Founded in 1954, R.S. Hughes Co., Inc. is a dynamic, North American distributor of industrial supplies. With 52 warehouse sites in the United States and Mexico, we maintain an extensive inventory of adhesives, abrasives, electrical, static control, tapes, labeling and safety products.

In addition to competitive salaries and benefits, we offer an environment that asks you to make a difference. We value hard work and common sense, and we consistently reward those that exemplify these traits. If you're looking for a great team to grow with and if you are willing to embrace the challenges of being expected to be the best, we welcome you to come join the R.S. Hughes Company, Inc. team!

Position Description

The Accountant position is primarily responsible for day-to-day duties associated with full cycle accounting, helping to manage the financial obligations for the company. This is a key position expected to handle financial reporting and analysis, month-end closing, general ledger reconciliation, forecasting and special projects. The successful Accountant must be comfortable working in a fast paced, expanding, and dynamic environment. This position requires someone with an extensive knowledge of acceptable accounting practices and procedures to assist with maintaining internal financial controls and procedures. This position is highly customer service oriented and requires excellent communication skills to work with internal teams and external partners. This role is expected to adhere to all company policies and safety protocols.

Key Competencies Required To Be Successful As An Accountant
• Daily maintenance and reconciliation of the general ledger for Liability, Equity, and Asset accounts to ensure accuracy and validity of accounting transactions.
• Consolidates and prepares monthly balance sheets, income statements, and profit and loss statements for multiple R.S. Hughes divisions.
• Daily review of subsidiary ledger accounts.
• Executes month-end close process by following internal procedures and protocols; including but not limited to settling suspense and clearing accounts.
• Reconciles cash disbursement accounts, payroll, customer accounts, and other financial accounts.
• Documents, creates, and posts journal entries.
• Manages accruals to accurately reflect obligations monthly.
• Performs regular internal audits to support financial accuracy, internal controls, and regulatory compliance.
• Files required tax forms in compliance with federal, state, and local government agencies requirements.
• Reconciles PO discrepancies and works with divisions and A/P to resolve.
• Proactively works and collaborates with Accounting and other Departments to support operational excellence, identifying process improvement opportunities.
• Consolidation of Subsidiary Systems into Master G/L.
• Performs other related duties as assigned.

Education/Certification/Licenses
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related discipline required.
• Three to five years of broad accounting experience required.

Skills That Will Make You Successful
• Extensive knowledge of general financial accounting.
• Understanding of and ability to adhere to generally accepted accounting principles.
• Highly proficient with accounting software.
• Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
• Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines without direct supervision.
• Ability to multi-task, while instinctively readjusting efforts to focus on high-priority tasks.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and especially Microsoft Excel.

Target Base Compensation range for this non-exempt role is $40.00 - $45.00/ hr. DOE.

This is a Full-Time position, eligible to participate in the Company’s benefit plans including: Paid Time off; major medical, dental, vision; Company paid short-term and long-term disability; paid parental leave; various supplemental benefit plans; and Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP).

title: Senior Financial Reporting Accountant
description:
Senior Accountant – Sr. Accountant – Senior Financial Reporting Analyst – Sr. Financial Reporting Analyst – Senior Technical Accountant – Sr. Technical Accountant – Acquisitions – Mergers – M&A – Business Combinations – ASC 805 – CPA – C.P.A. – Certified Public Accountant

Are you an experienced Senior Audit Associate in public accounting or Senior Accountant in industry who has strong experience in financial reporting and/or M&A accounting? If so, then we are working on a Senior Accountant that you would be a great fit for. Read more about this opportunity below!

A South Bay entertainment firm is looking for a Senior Accountant to join their team. In this role, the Senior Accountant will be responsible for everything related to new acquisitions, integrating acquired companies, first year reporting, and acquisitions accounting. To be successful in this role, the Senior Accountant should be very technical, have great communication skills, and be able to work in a team environment. Does this sound like you or someone you know? If so, then please read the full job description below to see if you would be a good fit for this Senior Accountant role.

What do you need for this Senior Accountant position?
• Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or related field
• 3+ years of technical accounting and/or financial reporting experience
• MUST have public accounting experience
• Should be working towards your CPA if you do not have one
• Advanced Excel

What will you do in this Senior Accountant position?
• Lead technical accounting research and write memos for complex acquisition transactions
• Ensure compliance with various accounting treatments and guidance like ASC 805
• Assist in the implementation and adoption of new accounting pronouncements
• Assist with journal entries, account reconciliations, and financial reporting as needed with the month-end close
• Support M&A activities including due diligence, purchase accounting, and integration efforts
• Prepare and review financial disclosures and footnotes for external reporting
• Develop and maintain internal controls over financial reporting to safeguard assets and data accuracy

What is in this Senior Accountant position for you?
• Reports to someone we know well that we placed
• Eat for free on campus
• Growing and global company
• Interesting acquisitions for someone who loves public accounting

title: Staff Accountant / Bookkeeper
description:
About The Organization

Our principal business is providing management of commercial parking facilities, either through the direct lease of parking facilities or under contract to Commercial Building Ownership or Property Management representing building ownership. Our ability to maintain business and employment stability and, indeed, to grow is dependent on meeting service commitments to our client's satisfaction. The term 'client' includes those with whom we provide contract management services and the general public who utilize our managed parking facilities. Our goal is to exceed client expectations and, in doing so, enhance our reputation as a premier parking facility management service provider. The achievement of this objective will enhance our ability to renew contracts and be a desired service provider in competing for new business.

Required Experience
• Excellent PC Skills with proficiency in QuickBooks Online and Microsoft Office (Above average Excel Level Skills)
• 2+ years of general ledger accounting or related financial experience.
• Strong analytical, organizational, problem-solving, and communication (Oral and Written) skills are required
• Able to work independently and in a team setting.

Job Responsibilities
• Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable processes, preparing aging reports, handling credit memos, and reviewing entries for monthly, quarterly, and yearly close.
• Analyzes accounts to ensure they are accurately booked into General Ledger.
• Review Positive Pay through the bank.
• Prepares and reviews monthly profit & loss. Balance sheet reconciliation and research any variance as well as ensure accuracy.
• Maintains efficient records and files for audit purposes.
• Prepares monthly closing journal entries for various accounting expenses.
• Point of contact for vendor communications, collections, and payments.
• Reconciles checks and credit card deposits, and bank statements, and ensures they are done in a timely manner. *Analyzes and Compares actual figures to budget figures for various accounting items, reviews variances*.
• Resolves issues and prepares journal entries for adjustments as needed. *Reviews accounts Payable invoices for accuracy*
• Ensures all accounting procedures and day-to-day transactions adhere to GAAP procedures.
• Adheres to internal control/ compliance policy procedures and possesses a high consciousness/ awareness of the Code of Ethics.
• Handles other accounting tasks as needed.

EOE Statement
• We are an equal opportunity employer and the qualified applicant will receive consideration for employment.

Compensation: DOE

This job is not a remote job. It requires individuals to be in office on a consistent basis.

description:

Location: Century City

Job Summary:

We are seeking a detail-oriented Junior Accountant to join our team. The Junior Accountant will assist with day-to-day accounting operations, including financial record-keeping, transaction processing, and supporting the finance team in preparing financial reports.

Key Responsibilities:

Transaction Processing:
• Record and maintain accurate financial transactions in accounting systems.
• Reconcile bank statements, accounts payable, and accounts receivable.

Financial Reporting:

• Assist with audits by providing necessary documentation and information.

Expense Management:
• Review and process expense reports in accordance with company policies.
• Monitor budgets and report variances to senior accountants or management.

Administrative Support:
• Maintain organized financial records and files.
• Provide general administrative support to the accounting team.

• Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP) and MS Office Suite, especially Excel.
• Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.
• Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
• Ability to handle sensitive financial information with confidentiality.

title: Accountant/CPA
description:
Overview
We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Certified Public Accountant (CPA) to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in financial accounting and tax preparation, with a commitment to delivering exceptional service to our clients. This role requires a thorough understanding of accounting principles, technical accounting skills, and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.

Duties
• Prepare and analyze financial statements to ensure accuracy and compliance with accounting standards.
• Manage payroll processing and ensure timely submission of payroll taxes.
• Assist clients with budgeting and financial planning, providing insights that drive informed decision-making.
• Provide expertise in Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) projects, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations.
• Offer guidance on wills, trusts, and estate law to clients as needed.
• Conduct technical accounting tasks, including reconciliations and adjustments.
• Prepare tax returns for individuals and businesses, ensuring compliance with federal, state, and local regulations.
• Utilize QuickBooks for bookkeeping and financial reporting tasks.
• Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry trends and changes in tax laws that may affect clients.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related field; CPA certification is required.
• Proven experience in financial accounting, tax preparation, and payroll management.
• Strong understanding of budgeting processes and financial acumen.
• Familiarity with LIHTC regulations is preferred but not mandatory.
• Excellent technical accounting skills with attention to detail.
• Proficient in QuickBooks and other accounting software applications.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex financial data.
• Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to explain financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders.

Join our team as a Certified Public Accountant where you can leverage your expertise while contributing to the success of our clients!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $57,560.72 - $69,320.44 per year

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• 401(k) matching
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Ability to Commute:
• Placentia, CA 92870 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:
• Placentia, CA 92870: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Analyst, Data Science & Analytics
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!

If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.

Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.
• We love all pets like our own
• We’re the future of the pet industry
• We’re here to improve lives
• We drive outstanding results together
• We’re welcome as we are

Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.

Essential Job Functions
• Leverage advanced analytical techniques and programming languages to mine through massive data sets and isolate patterns in customer purchase behavior, store performance, and competitive pricing schemes (predictive modeling, clustering, design of experiments, etc).
• Work with other team members to influence strategic decisions and create accurate financial forecasts based on deep customer behavior analyses with tangible recommendations to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value.
• Utilize exceptional communication skills to present findings across the business by effectively translating complex data and analysis into clear insights, opportunities, and tangible business recommendations;
• Develop reports, dashboards and build compelling data visualizations that effectively measure, track, and quantify changes in customer behavior and spend patterns.
• Contribute to complex long-term projects from initial scoping through full execution and training with inputs from a variety of cross-functional teams (IT, Merchandising, Marketing).
• Collaborate with data science team as an expert on the business by providing direction on how to best leverage advanced modeling techniques and machine learning algorithms to achieve strategic objectives and business goals.
• Display deep intellectual curiosity, creativity, and commitment to learning in order to solve critical business problems and push the boundary of our capabilities.

Required Skills and Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in economics, statistics, math or related business field; Master’s preferred
• Minimum of 1 years of experience in analytics or statistics capacity, 2 years ideal
• Experience with statistical programming languages required (R a must, Python, SAS)
• Experience building large data sets across disparate sources required (SQL, Hive, Hadoop)
• Desire to learn new analytic and data manipulation techniques to become an ‘local expert’
• Advanced presentation skills required (PowerPoint, Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator, R packages)
• Experience with pricing, merchandising, marketing and the retail industry strongly preferred
• Ability to think conceptually and creatively about problems and solutions
• Strong interpersonal communication skills, verbal and written, required due to the nature and level of interaction with senior management
• Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and ability to manage multiple projects while meeting deadlines

Note: Current responsibilities are impacted by company and team priorities that may have evolved from what is displayed in the Workday job profile. The description provides general job duties and requirements, but the partner’s manager may assign additional responsibilities or tasks depending on business needs.

Are you curious, creative, and love data? Do you enjoy collaborating with colleagues and using data to drive actionable insights? Do you want to be on the cutting edge of breakthroughs in data and analytics, encouraged to discover, challenged to think bigger, and supported to learn new things personally and professionally?

The Walt Disney Studios seeks a Data Analyst to join the Studio Research & Analytics team. The Digital Analytics team is a highly visible department that is charged with finding the best methods to understand consumer thoughts, feelings, and behaviors across digital and social channels. They play an integral part in aiding key business decisions for Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Lucasfilm, and Disney+. You will join a dynamic group who love movies and television and are passionate about bringing the consumer voice into studio decision-making every day.

You will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data related to Disney’s digital and social media efforts by providing valuable insights and recommendations to drive informed business decisions. This role will have a deep focus on audience development for Lucasfilm, particularly the Star Wars and Star Wars Kids YouTube channels. This is a highly visible role that requires exceptional analytical capabilities, a deep understanding of digital and social media platforms, and the ability to organize, visualize, and translate complex data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with internal stakeholders to provide digital business insights for Lucasfilm and other Studio brands, with a focus on YouTube growth opportunities
• Be the voice of the consumer and a thought leader for Disney digital marketing teams, with an emphasis on Lucasfilm groups. Effectively communicate both quantitative and qualitative findings with timely, relevant, and actionable insights to support short-term and long-term decision-making
• Translate business questions into data-informed insights by proactively exploring analytics resources and requirements. Leverage digital and social listening tools to track, trend, and understand consumer behaviors, expressed preferences, and responses to marketing efforts
• Provide recommendations to grow Disney’s suite of YouTube channels and content that are supported by a robust analytic framework
• Produce reporting deliverables for executive leaders spanning the full suite of The Walt Disney Studios brands, including YouTube channel growth reporting on a monthly basis and full digital insights on a quarterly basis
• Present complex information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences, including executive levels in the company

Qualifications:
• At least 2 years of experience in data analytics with a focus on social media, digital marketing, and/or consumer data
• Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Psychology, or a related field or equivalent experience
• Proficiency with YouTube analytics
• Proficiency with analytics provided by TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, Threads, and X
• Passion for historical and current Star Wars storytelling across all forms of media, including film, television, comics, and games
• Proficiency with social analytics and listening tools, e.g. Sprinklr, Quid
• Familiarity with website analytics tools, e.g. Adobe Analytics
• Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Drive (Sheets, Slides) systems
• Outstanding communication and critical thinking skills, as well as the ability to make clear and concise visual presentations
• Ability to interpret data and combine with other data sources to develop a rich, complete picture for the business
• Exceptional analytical thinking and mathematical skills
• Strong understanding of design best practices for presentation decks and dashboards
• Ability to work rapidly and efficiently in a fast-paced and changing environment
• This role requires in-person collaboration from Monday to Thursday and remote work on Friday

The hiring range for this position in Burbank, CA is $78,200 - $104,800 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Logistics Data Analyst
description:
Key Responsibilities:
• Data Modeling & Performance Analytics
• Deliver weekly/monthly fulfillment reports covering order performance, exceptions, SKU movement, and inventory distribution
• Develop and maintain logistics KPI dashboards to support fulfillment tracking for online channels (Shopify DTC, TikTok Shop, Amazon FBA) and offline channels (retail stores, distributors, vending machines)
• Extract, clean, and analyze data from WMS/OMS/ERP systems to ensure accuracy, completeness, and usability
• Build automated reporting templates and dashboards for cross-functional teams (operations, sales, customer service, finance)
• Warehouse & Channel KPI Monitoring
• Monitor key warehouse and channel metrics weekly, such as inbound timeliness, outbound accuracy, picking efficiency, inventory variance rate, and storage utilization
• Benchmark warehouse performance and identify inefficiencies, providing data-driven improvement suggestions
• Track marketplace-specific KPIs (on-time delivery, late shipment rate, return rate, negative review rate), issue alerts, and support resolution with operations
• Cost Analysis & Budget Support
• Compile monthly logistics cost reports, covering warehousing, transportation (UPS), returns, and operational expenses
• Analyze unit fulfillment costs by order/channel/product, and recommend cost optimization strategies
• Assist in annual logistics budget planning and cost model development

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree or above in Mathematics, Statistics, Logistics, Supply Chain, or related field
• Minimum 2 years of experience in logistics/supply chain data analytics; eCommerce experience preferred
• Proficient in Excel, SQL, and BI tools (Power BI, Tableau) with strong data extraction and modeling skills
• Familiar with WMS, OMS, and ERP systems data structures and operations
• Strong cross-functional communication, logical thinking, and self-management
• Bilingual in Mandarin and English (written and spoken)

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience with multi-warehouse coordination, fulfillment performance tracking, or eCommerce optimization
• Familiarity with Pop Mart's product characteristics and sales rhythms; ability to translate data into actionable insights

Work Place：North America

Please be noted that this position will involve business trips to China.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Local Candidates Only

No Relocation Package offered.

Data Analyst - Foodservice Distribution

Location

715 E California, Ontario, CA 91761 In-Person/On-site position

Company Overview

We are a $500M foodservice distributor based in California, delivering high-quality products and services to our customers. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team and drive data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Job Summary

The Data Analyst will develop and maintain reporting tools to provide actionable insights into key business metrics, including sales, gross profit, customer trends, item and category performance, supply chain, inbound/outbound logistics, transportation, and credit. This role will involve creating intuitive dashboards and reports while collaborating with end users to ensure they understand the metrics, charts, and insights generated. The ideal candidate is a proactive problem-solver with strong technical skills and the ability to communicate complex data in a clear, user-friendly manner.

Key Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and maintain reporting tools and dashboards using tools like Power BI, Excel, and SQL to track trends across all business departments.
• Analyze data related to sales, gross profit, customer behavior, item/categories, supply chain, logistics, and credit to identify trends and opportunities.
• Collaborate with end users to understand their reporting needs and translate requirements into effective data visualizations and insights.
• Train and support non-technical end users in interpreting metrics, charts, and reports to empower data-driven decision-making.
• Ensure data accuracy and integrity by validating and cleaning datasets from various sources.
• Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis to optimize business performance.
• Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in data analytics and visualization.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
• 3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in foodservice distribution, supply chain, or a related industry.
• Proficiency in Excel, Power Query, Power Pivot, SQL, Power Automate, Power BI, and DAX (or similar visualization tools) for data manipulation, analysis, and reporting.
• Strong ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to train and support end users.
• Experience working with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver solutions.
• Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Knowledge of foodservice distribution metrics (e.g., inventory turnover, gross margin, logistics) is a plus.

Benefits
• Competitive salary and benefits package.
• Opportunity to make a significant impact in a growing $500M organization.
• Collaborative and dynamic work environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $86,813.00 - $90,311.00 per year

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• 401(k) matching
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday
• Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Data Analyst - 13 Week Local Contract
description:
Technical Skills:

Now Hiring: Analyst 1 – Data Analyst

At Elite Healthcare Staffing, we know that data accuracy is critical to patient safety and operational excellence. We’re seeking a detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you’ll be a trusted resource, ensuring accuracy in medical record systems and managing patient identity with precision.

Key Responsibilities
• Patient Identity Management & Data Integrity
• Perform chart corrections to ensure accurate documentation for each patient and encounter.
• Validate and merge duplicate medical record numbers, verifying demographic and identifying details.
• Confirm suspected duplicates by comparing:
• Patient name and spelling
• Birthdate
• Social Security Number
• Address & phone numbers
• Driver’s license number
• Signatures
• Emergency contacts and relatives
• Insurance plans and policy numbers
• Clinical records and physician details
• Any other relevant identifiers

Merge & Unmerge Operations
• Make informed decisions on which record number to retain by reviewing:
• Number of associated cases
• Dates and timelines of cases
• Outstanding charges
• Demographic consistency
• Encounter and media type information
• Execute merging and unmerging processes accurately to maintain data integrity.

Reporting & Communication
• Conduct qualitative reviews and resolve discrepancies flagged in Identity Reports.

Manage:
• Patient Overlays: Resolve name, date of birth, or SSN updates.
• Potential Merges: Evaluate and resolve records marked for merge.
• Potential Unmerges: Investigate and correct possible merge errors.
• Duplicate Reports: Identify and resolve duplicate records using appropriate tools.
• Track the origin of duplicate numbers and provide feedback to departments as needed.
• Update ancillary departments with surviving medical record information.
• Perform block number assignments during system downtime.

Resource & Support
• Serve as a resource person for identity verification across departments.
• Assign correct medical record numbers to unidentified documentation.
• Respond to calls in the number control area and assist with record identification questions.
• Maintain professionalism and exceptional customer service, even under pressure.

Required Knowledge & Skills
• Minimum typing speed: 40 WPM
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
• Ability to operate and troubleshoot standard office equipment.

Interpersonal Skills:
• Communicate clearly and professionally in English.
• Stay calm and courteous under pressure.
• Strong time management and organizational skills.
• Professional appearance consistent with company standards.

Why Choose Elite Healthcare Staffing?

At Elite Healthcare Staffing, we put your expertise first. You’ll join a supportive team that values accuracy, collaboration, and integrity. We offer opportunities designed to support your growth, work-life balance, and professional development.

Take the Next Step

If you are proactive, detail-oriented, and passionate about ensuring data quality, Elite Healthcare Staffing invites you to apply.

Apply today and elevate your career as a trusted Data Analyst with Elite!

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $21.01 per hour

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Day shift
• Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Business Data Analyst
description:
Overview

Founded in 1973, Inter-Con Security Systems, Inc. is a leading US-owned security company, providing a full range of physical security services to government and commercial customers on four continents. Inter-Con (ICS) provides custom client solutions tailored to quality with the flexibility to operate in highly complex environments. The firm specializes in providing tailored services to clients whose needs exceed the sophistication and expertise of traditional guard firms. Inter-Con remains under family ownership and control and operates as the industry leader in the field of customized, high-requirement security solutions. Inter-Con employs over 25,000 security personnel world-wide, trained and managed by a team of professionals with unsurpassed military, law enforcement, and security experience.

Inter-Con is Everywhere Security Matters.

Job Summary:

As a Strategic Operations Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to ensure the quality of data output for paying and billing all assigned accounts. In a fast-paced environment, you will identify any issues that could impact payroll and invoicing and take proactive measures to resolve them by coordinating with relevant departments. Additionally, you will utilize your analytical skills to generate deliverables that comply with all technical specifications outlined in the contract.

Primary Responsibilities:
• Prepare timesheets for Payroll & Invoicing by leveraging Salesforce exception reporting and audit reports
• Manage Salesforce task and case load
• Identify and escalate operational issues impacting pay/bill quality and timeliness, such as unjustified overtime.
• Coordinate with appropriate leadership cross-functionally to drive resolution on operational issues.
• Oversight of personnel, with management and scheduling thereof
• Seamlessly hand off pay/bill deliverables to downstream departments.
• Provide clear and concise pay/bill status reporting on demand, as well as concrete forecast.
• Train Operations on Pay Bill process and procedures to support a smooth pay bill operation.
• Work in Salesforce and Excel on data sets to audit, correct, and create data load files.
• Projections and variances

Qualifications:
• 1 to 3 years of experience utilizing Salesforce within a medium to large organization preferred. Salesforce Trailhead completions also preferred.
• Proficient at web-interface reporting tools and data manipulation using Excel (pivot tables, Index & Match).
• Basic understanding of Payroll and Billing fundamentals. Experience in FP&A is a plus
• Skilled at transforming and aligning data to meet specific technical requirements.
• Highly detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Other Requirements or Competencies:
• Proven ability to meet objectives and deadlines in fast-paced, high-pressure environments.
• Highly motivated, positive, and collaborative team player with a strong work ethic and high integrity.
• Flexible and adaptable to change in dynamic work settings.
• Consistently delivers accurate, high-quality work with strong attention to detail.

Inter-Con Security Systems, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Disability/Veteran.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
Job Title: Data Quality Analyst

Company: Globalstor Data Corporation LLC.

Are you passionate about data quality and have a keen eye for detail? Do you want to work for a leading data management company with a global presence? Then we have the perfect job opportunity for you!

Globalstor Data Corporation LLC. is seeking a Data Quality Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Data Quality Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data across our organization.

Responsibilities:

• Develop and implement data quality standards, policies, and procedures to improve data accuracy and reliability

• Monitor and analyze data quality metrics to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions

• Collaborate with data sources and stakeholders to understand and resolve data quality issues

• Conduct data audits and identify data quality issues, root causes, and provide recommendations for resolution

• Define and maintain data quality rules and perform regular data quality checks to ensure compliance

• Communicate data quality processes and guidelines to internal teams and provide training as needed

• Stay updated on industry trends and best practices related to data quality management and implement them within the organization

Requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, or a related field

• 2+ years of experience in data quality analysis or a similar role

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail

• Proficient in SQL and experience working with databases

• Knowledge of data quality tools and methodologies

• Experience with data profiling, mapping, and standardization

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

• Ability to work independently and in a team environment

Join our team at Globalstor Data Corporation LLC. and be a part of our growing organization. We offer a competitive salary, benefits package, and opportunities for career growth and development.

If you have a passion for data quality and want to work for a company that values its employees, then apply now for the Data Quality Analyst position at Globalstor Data Corporation LLC.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Overview and Responsibilities:

Paramount is looking for a Data Analyst to join the team! We seek a candidate who consistently prioritizes data quality and demonstrates an unwavering attention to detail. They will be technically savvy and be able to navigate complex enterprise systems while working in a fast-paced, collaborative corporate environment. This role works with the Vice President of Sales Planning & Reporting and will support Paramount Home Entertainment's analysis and reporting projects.

Responsibilities:
• Lead all aspects of the collection, cleaning, and harmonization of metadata for internal databases to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
• Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate data-driven insights to partners.
• Work closely with multi-functional teams, including IT, marketing, finance, and operations, to support data-driven decision-making processes.
• Identify and interpret trends and/or patterns within complex data sets.
• Support the team in all requests that relate to our function, with a “can-do” attitude and always looking to over deliver what is required.

Basic Qualifications:
• Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as SQL, Python, R, Tableau.
• Understanding of statistical methods, data modeling, and predictive analytics.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex data insights to non-technical partners.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
• Demonstrated ability to work closely in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Additional Qualifications:
• A bachelor’s degree in computer science, Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field is preferred.
• Experience with Snowflake, GitHub, and AWS.
• 3+ years of experience at an entertainment studio and/or streaming platform.

Paramount Global (NASDAQ: PARA, PARAA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic studios, networks and streaming services, Paramount's portfolio of consumer brands includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Hiring Salary Range: $56,000.00 - 70,000.00. The hiring salary range for this position applies to New York City, California, Colorado, Washington state, and most other geographies. Starting pay for the successful applicant depends on a variety of job-related factors, including but not limited to geographic location, market demands, experience, training, and education. The benefits available for this position include medical, dental, vision, 401(k) plan, life insurance coverage, disability benefits, tuition assistance program and PTO or, if applicable, as otherwise dictated by the appropriate Collective Bargaining Agreement.

Paramount is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) including disability/vet.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access as a result of your disability. title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Job Description

Role: Power BI Data Analyst

Location: Irvine, CA – Hybrid (4 days onsite per week)

Duration: 12 Months (Temp to Perm Hire)

Summary:

The main function of a Data Analyst is to coordinate changes to computer databases, test, implement the database applying knowledge of database management systems, visualize in Power BI the data as per team requirements. Primary function is to support client’s PMO within a business unit; this is not an IT department facing role.

Job Responsibilities:

Database Expertise –
• Work with PPM tool, to support and identify tables for reporting. The analyst will update ingestion to include new tables, update semantic model, update reports as requested by stakeholders.
• Design, develop, deployment, manage on-going improvement of the data warehouse, portals and dashboards by partnering with stakeholders. Manage the complete data pipeline, from the data mart all the way through to end-user BI tools (e.g., data intake, validation, mining, modeling, visualization and reporting)
• Work with senior management, technical and client teams in order to determine data requirements, business data implementation approaches, best practices for advanced data manipulation, storage and analysis strategies.
• Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions
• Design, implement, automate and maintain large scale enterprise data ETL processes.
• Modify existing databases and database management systems and/or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.
• Test programs or databases, correct errors and make necessary modifications

Analytical Expertise-
• Identify, evaluate, cleanse, organize, and assess value of disparate data sources. Identify data sources available and collect primary data where necessary.
• Partner with team to develop new analyses; collaborate with stakeholders through fact based analyses, drive change, and develop solutions. Continually improve user experience for Business Intelligence reports and dashboards.
• Perform ad hoc analysis as assigned and actively identify new opportunities for value-add analytics.

Required Skills:
• Dataflow Gen2
• Star Schema Modeling
• Power BI knowledge including: RLS & Semantic modeling
• Data retrieval from PPM tool database using ODt connector for full and incremental loads

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.
• 5-7 years applicable experience required.
• Experience with database technologies
• Knowledge of the ETL process
• Knowledge of at least one scripting language
• Strong written and oral communication skills
• Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills
• Demonstrated history of success
• Desire to be working with data and helping businesses make better data driven decisions.

title: Logistics - Data Analyst I
description:
Description

Join Our Team as a Data Analyst I

Are you passionate about turning data into insights that drive impactful decisions? We’re looking for a Logistics Data Analyst I to support our growing logistics, operations, and analytics initiatives. In this role, you'll play a key part in transforming complex data into clear, actionable intelligence that helps shape strategic business outcomes—particularly in optimizing logistics performance and operational efficiency.

You’ll collaborate across departments to develop and implement data standards, build automation tools, and deliver meaningful reports and dashboards. This is a great opportunity to apply your analytical mindset and technical skills—like advanced statistics and programming—to real-world business and logistics challenges.

If you're eager to grow your career in data and thrive in a fast-paced, solution-oriented environment, we want to hear from you!

Requirements

What You Will Do:
• Manage master data including creation, updates, and deletions across systems.
• Administer user access and roles within the data reporting environment.
• Ensure quality assurance of imported data; work with QA analysts when needed.
• Commission and decommission data sets as required for business projects.
• Process and safeguard confidential data in accordance with internal policies.
• Design, build, and maintain reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.
• Manage the reporting environment including data sources, security settings, and metadata structures.
• Collaborate with business units to gather reporting requirements and support data warehouse enhancements.
• Support initiatives to improve data integrity, normalization, and standardization.
• Assess and implement new or upgraded reporting tools and data systems.
• Generate reports from single or multiple systems to meet various business needs.
• Troubleshoot reporting systems and resolve data issues impacting reporting.
• Evaluate updates and changes to source systems and ensure downstream alignment.
• Train end-users and stakeholders on how to access and interpret data dashboards and tools.
• Provide technical expertise in database structures, data mining, and cleansing processes.
• Perform other duties as assigned.
• This may require some travel to other Full Swing locations.

Do You Have:
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field.
• 1-2 years’ experience in purchasing, supply chain or warehouse management
• Experience working as a data analyst or in a related analytical or technical role.
• Proficiency in data analytics and visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Excel).
• High-level experience in methodologies and best practices for managing and analyzing large data sets.
• Ability to assess and mitigate data risks and support decision-making with meaningful insights.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into accessible information for non-technical audiences.

You’ll Shine Even Brighter If:
• Experience with Salesforce, NetSuite & PowerBI

What We Offer:
• Comprehensive Benefits Package – Medical, dental, and vision coverage, plus more
• 401(k) with Company Match – Up to 4% contribution match
• Paid Time Off – Generous PTO and paid holidays
• Supportive Work Environment – A relaxed, non-corporate atmosphere
• Team Culture – Engaging team bonding events and activities
• Onsite Wellness – Access to a personal trainer and gym facilities for a healthy work-life balance

Ready to Grow with Us?

At our company, rapid growth means endless opportunities! We’re committed to developing talent from within, offering clear career advancement paths across all roles. Over 70% of our managers—and many other key team members—were promoted internally. If you're eager to grow and make an impact, join us and see where your potential can take you!

Full Swing Golf is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe everyone has the power to make a difference and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, color, gender, religion, marital or domestic partner status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship, or genetic information. If you need an accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact hr@fullswigngolf.com.
