title: AI Data Analyst
description:
Description:

Company Overview:

At ProSites, we leverage data-driven insights to help community-based professionals—including dentists, accountants, and veterinarians—grow their businesses. Our digital marketing solutions generate a wealth of valuable data, and we are looking for an AI Data Analyst to structure, analyze, and extract meaningful insights from this data to drive strategic decision-making for our customers, geographies, and market segments.

Position Overview:

As an AI Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing and managing data structures, applying machine learning techniques, and delivering actionable insights that help refine our marketing strategies and enhance customer success. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our data is efficiently organized, analyzed, and translated into business intelligence that informs both internal and external stakeholders.

This role requires a strong foundation in AI-driven data analysis, data engineering, and visualization, as well as the ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical audiences.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Structuring & Management
• Build and maintain a scalable data architecture to organize digital marketing results across various customer segments, geographies, and industries.
• Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and accessibility, working closely with engineering teams to optimize data pipelines.

AI-Powered Analytics & Machine Learning
• Apply machine learning algorithms (supervised & unsupervised) to uncover trends, customer behaviors, and performance patterns.
• Develop predictive models to enhance marketing effectiveness, customer segmentation, and campaign performance.
• Continuously evaluate and improve model performance through feature engineering and hyperparameter tuning.

Business Insights & Decision Support
• Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights for internal teams and customers.
• Identify key performance drivers and provide strategic recommendations based on AI-driven analysis.
• Support marketing, sales, and product teams by delivering tailored analytics for business growth initiatives.

Data Visualization & Reporting
• Develop intuitive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate insights effectively.
• Utilize tools like Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, or Seaborn to present complex data in a digestible manner.
• Regularly share insights with stakeholders, leadership, and clients to drive data-informed decision-making.

Collaboration & Continuous Improvement
• Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and marketing teams to align analytics with business objectives.
• Stay up to date with AI trends, digital marketing analytics, and emerging data technologies to improve processes.
• Proactively identify new opportunities for AI-driven insights and business optimization.

Required Skills & Qualifications:

Technical Proficiency
• Strong programming skills in Python, R, or SQL for data analysis and model development.
• Hands-on experience with AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, or similar.
• Expertise in data manipulation tools (Pandas, NumPy) and database management (SQL, NoSQL, data warehousing).

Analytical & Statistical Expertise
• Deep understanding of machine learning techniques (classification, regression, clustering, anomaly detection).
• Strong statistical foundation for hypothesis testing, A/B testing, and predictive modeling.

Business & Communication Skills
• Ability to translate complex AI-driven insights into clear, strategic recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
• Experience working with marketing performance data, customer segmentation, or digital advertising analytics is a plus.

Data Visualization & Reporting
• Proficiency with Tableau, Power BI, Seaborn, Matplotlib, or other visualization tools.
• Ability to create user-friendly reports and dashboards that drive strategic decision-making.

Education & Experience
• 3+ years of experience in AI, data analytics, or a related field.
• Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
• Certifications in AI, Data Science, or Business Intelligence tools are a plus.

Why Join ProSites?

Make an Impact – Be at the forefront of AI-driven analytics, shaping insights that drive real business outcomes.

Collaborative Culture – Work with a team that values innovation, data-driven decision-making, and cross-functional collaboration.

Career Growth – Gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge AI techniques while developing strategic business intelligence.

If you are passionate about leveraging AI to turn data into actionable business insights, we invite you to apply and be part of our journey in driving data-powered growth for small businesses.

title: Sr Data Analyst
description:
WHO WE ARE

Crossmedia is the global media independent. We’re committed to doing media and business the right way, guided by the principles of TRUST, REASON and the pursuit of HAPPINESS. Crossmedia US was founded in NY in 2000 and is one of the largest minority-owned full-service media planning & buying agencies in the nation. We are 500+ Crossmedians worldwide with big ambitions to continue to grow with soul.

We focus on what media agencies should do: create innovative connections between brands and people regardless of channel or budget. And, we do it in an honest way. We are and always have been a values-based organization. We earn our clients TRUST by ensuring media transparency in our business model and objectivity in decision-making. We apply REASON & logic to finding solutions to our clients' greatest business challenges. The pursuit of HAPPINESS matters to us. Big time. We invest in each colleagues’ professional & personal wellbeing and growth. It’s why we have countless initiatives, clubs & cultural events dedicated to our people and why we have been the top ranked media agency named to Ad Age’s Best Places to Work for the past six years in a row.

Our client roster includes US Bank, PWC, Invesco, Newell Brands, NASCAR, Planet Fitness, Teremana, American Cancer Society, White Castle, Ricola, Supercuts, Edible Arrangements, Illva Saronno, Zalando, Airbus and more.

YOUR ROLE

We are looking for a passionate, collaborative, and adaptable Sr. Analyst to join our team. The Analytics group (Redbox) is passionate about data analysis, measurement, and storytelling. We are nimble and scrappy, employing multiple traditional and non-traditional methods and data sources to tackle consumer insights, audience exploration, brand health, competitive analysis, media attribution, media accountability, data dashboarding and advanced modeling. We believe it is important to guide clients’ media effectiveness measurement to be holistic, capture incrementality, and focus on business outcomes (not vanity media metrics).

As a Sr. Analyst you will drive day to day analytics excellence for our clients. You will help promote data driven decision making across the agency and with our clients. You will collaborate with New Business, Strategy, and Account Tems. The agency looks to the Analytics group for direction, strategic thinking, and prowess in data science. This role is remote but we are seeking a candidate with proximity to the Los Angeles area for occasional team meetings.
• You have a love of data, analysis, and creative problem solving
• Are comfortable leading client conversations
• Have solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking agility
• Adaptable, proactive, and able to work independently or in a team setting as needed
• Don’t mind rolling your sleeves up for data cleansing, data visualization, and analysis
• Not afraid to speak up, ask questions, share your thoughts, and listen to others

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Transform raw data into engaging visuals and compelling stories. You will bring data and research to life for clients and choose the best visuals and mediums to deliver your message.
• Translate clients’ business questions into an actionable measurement frameworks.
• Generate quantitative and qualitative consumer and market research including:
• Demographic, psychographic, and behavioral customer profiling
• Media channel coverage, penetration, receptivity
• Brand health deep dives
• Competitive analysis
• Help media team understand historical media performance, optimal media budget, and allocate budget across multiple media channels

REQUIREMENTS
• 2-3 years of experience in the marketing analytics space.
• Experience creating data visualizations and dashboards to support media investment decision making
• Past use of common media research tools: YouGov, MRI-Simmons, Scarborough, GWI (Global Web Index), Vivvix, Pathmatics, or Nielsen Media Impact
• Hands on experience with media measurement approaches including marketing mix modelling (MMM), multi-touch attribution (MTA), experimentation, or brand lift studies.
• Knowledge of statistical techniques (multivariate regression, optimization, clustering, forecasting)
• Familiarity with programming languages is a plus (R, Python, dbt, SQL)

Location: Remote but seeking a candidate with proximity to the Los Angeles area for occasional team meetings

Salary: 75,000-95,000. Commensurate with experience. Compensation is determined on the skills, qualifications, certifications, tenure in the industry and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position.

CROSSMEDIA BENEFITS

Our principles of Trust, Reason, and the Pursuit of Happiness are brought to life through benefits that recognize and support the diversity and physical, emotional, and professional well-being of our people, including:
• Flexibility to work in hybrid manner with in-office and work from home options (depending on role).
• Open/Flexible PTO with US & UK specific policies
• Sponsored healthcare options and agency-wide physical & mental health support
• 401k with company match (USA), and generous Pension (UK)
• Paid sabbatical at significant milestone anniversaries
• Generous paid parental leave policy
• Life milestone recognition & support
• The Pursuit of Happiness Fund devoted to helping Crossmedians find their happy (be it travel, enrichment class, fitness membership or professional development)
• Cell phone/tech reimbursement
• Student Loan payment plan (US)
• Tuition reimbursement
• Learning & Development and training programs
• And burgers – lots and lots of burgers

COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION

Diversity is in our DNA. As a minority-owned company, our commitment to an inclusive environment has long been embedded into agency practices and at every level. Almost one third of senior leadership identifies as a person of color and over half of our executive leadership are women. We have active mentoring & internship programs that create opportunities for underrepresented groups. Internal agency programming is anchored by XMEquity365, a permanent, year-round initiative fostering acknowledgement and support of marginalized communities within five pillars – Excellence, Voices, Education, Giving & Representation.

Crossmedia is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and creating a diverse and inclusive company culture and that does not discriminate against candidates and employees because of their disability, sex, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law.

All job requirements are subject to possible revision to reflect changes in the position requirements, business necessities and/or to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Essential and other job functions are subject to modification. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to which will be required in this position. Employees will be required to follow other job-related duties as requested by their supervisor/manager (within guidelines and compliance with Federal and State Laws).

Continued employment remains on an “at-will” basis.” Reasonable accommodations may be provided to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions in compliance with the American with Disabilities Act of 1990.

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job:
• Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time.
• Ability to stand, bend, and reach
• Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, and computer printer.
• The ability to communicate information and ideas so others will understand. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.
• The ability to observe details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).

In compliance with the current Americans with Disabilities Act and state and local laws, if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation to apply for a position with Crossmedia, please email people.team@xmedia.com.

title: Senior Analyst, Data Platforming Engineering
description:
CULTIVATE A BETTER WORLD

Food served fast does not have to be a typical fast-food experience. Chipotle has always done things differently, both in and out of our restaurants. We are changing the face of fast food, starting conversations, and directly supporting efforts to shift the future of farming and food. We hope you will join us as we continue to learn, evolve, and shape what comes next on our mission to make better food accessible to everyone.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As the Senior Analyst, Data Platforming Engineering, you will be an active participant and driver in ensuring our platform and infrastructure continue to mature and evolve to support current and future data initiatives, security and reliability. Responsibilities include ensuring our platforms adhere to our Data Governance, Data Security and access standards. Additionally, you will help drive our Customer Data Platform strategy and implementation through thought leadership and platform instantiation. Your experience and thought leadership will be able to make a direct impact as we modernize the way we deploy, maintain and scale our platforms.

LOCATION
• This position will be based on site at our Newport Beach, CA office. Remote work is not available for this role.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
• Develop automated deployment frameworks for Snowflake platform (Infrastructure as a Service).
• Integrate Terraform with the Snowflake platform.
• Role Based Access Control (RBAC) framework design & Snowflake platform support for customer pursuit of SOX compliance. This includes auditing and monitoring of network policies, service accounts and user management.
• Implement data security, approve authentication and privacy through DIA platforms.
• Provide critical support in ensuring the current and future state Customer Data Platform aligns with the DIA strategic architecture.
• Create detailed design documents based on solutions designs and work with internal and external teams to implement.
• Provide technical inputs and leadership into the maturation of Chipotle’s data management platforms.

WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO THE TABLE
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Finance, or Statistics preferred.
• 3-5 years of experience with Snowflake, managing data governance and security including Role Based Access Controls, Authentication and Monitoring.
• 3-5 years of experience with customer data platforms like Amperity, Microsoft or others is ideal.
• Strong understanding ADO, CICD and agile methodologies.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills with experience presenting to different levels of leadership related discipline.
• Solid knowledge of implementing database security, access controls and compliance remediation.
• Experience working in a fast-paced, enterprise environment is a plus.
• Ability to handle ambiguity and provide technical leadership to improve our processes, patterns and standards.

PAY TRANSPARENCY

A reasonable estimate of the current base pay range for this position is $99,000.00–$135,000.00. You are also eligible for annual cash bonuses and equity awards based upon performance and other factors. Actual compensation offered may vary depending on skill level, experience, and/or education. Chipotle offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401k, sick leave, vacation time, and much more. Visit https://jobs.chipotle.com/benefits for more details.

WHO WE ARE

Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without artificial colors, flavors or preservatives. Chipotle has restaurants in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France and Germany and is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants in North America and Europe. With employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology and sustainable business practices. For more information or to place an order online, visit WWW.CHIPOTLE.COM

Chipotle Mexican Grill is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. As a people-first company rooted in values, our purpose extends beyond serving nutritious food using real ingredients. It means hiring world-class individuals and fostering a culture that champions diversity, ensures equity, and celebrates inclusion. All qualified applicants, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply.

Qualified applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and/or certain state or local laws. Please contact ADAaccommodations@chipotle.comif you need an accommodation due to a disability to complete an application, job interview, and/or to otherwise participate in the hiring process. This email does not respond to non-accommodations related requests.

title: SR DATA ANALYST
description:
Responsibilities

Valley Hospital Medical Center
Located in the heart of Las Vegas, Valley Hospital Medical Center is an acute care and teaching hospital that has provided high quality healthcare to residents of Southern Nevada since 1972. The hospital offers a comprehensive range of services, including advanced cardiology, neurology, surgery and more.

The Valley Health System (VHS), with seven hospitals in Las Vegas and Southern Nevada, is looking for exceptional people who share our vision and values. We focus on clearly defined goals designed to bring about exemplary patient care. We give our employees the structure to achieve these goals by providing advanced technological systems, processes, and practice; performance improvement and patient safety standards to foster positive patient outcomes; a collaborative practice model; evidence-based practice; and education and development programs to support recruitment and retention.

VHS is owned and operated by a subsidiary of Universal Health Services, Inc. (UHS). Each employee at VHS takes part in the UHS Service Excellence Program. The program is guided by three standards: "Treat everyone as a guest. Demonstrate professionalism and excellence in the things I do. Practice teamwork." The talent and dedication of all UHS employees is what makes the company unique.

Benefit Highlights
• Challenging and rewarding work environment
• Competitive Compensation & Generous Paid Time Off
• Excellent Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Plans
• 401(K) with company match and discounted stock plan
• SoFi Student Loan Refinancing Program
• Career development opportunities within UHS and its 300+ Subsidiaries! · More information is available on our Benefits Guest Website: uhsguest.com

About Universal Health Services

One of the nation’s largest and most respected providers of hospital and healthcare services, Universal Health Services, Inc. (NYSE: UHS) has built an impressive record of achievement and performance, growing since its inception into a Fortune 500 corporation. Headquartered in King of Prussia, PA, UHS has 99,000 employees. Through its subsidiaries, UHS operates 28 acute care hospitals, 331 behavioral health facilities, 60 outpatient and other facilities in 39 U.S. States, Washington, D.C., Puerto Rico and the United Kingdom.

Job Description:

Responsible for the collection, analysis, formatting, and displaying data pertinent to the patient care processes. Provides technical and analytic support to the System Quality/Performance Improvement Department and Hospital Quality Directors.

Qualifications

Education: Associates Degree Required. Bachelor’s Degree Preferred. Minimum of five (5) years applicable experience may be substituted for Associates Degree upon approval of Director.

Experience: Three to five (3-5) years’ experience in quality informatics

Technical Skills: Strong project management skills. Computer proficiency to include Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, Visio, and Databases.

Other: Must have working knowledge of healthcare industry. Healthcare Information Management preferred.

EEO Statement

All UHS subsidiaries are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates. UHS subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and as such, openly support and fully commit to recruitment, selection, placement, promotion and compensation of individuals without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), genetic information, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Avoid and Report Recruitment Scams

We are aware of a scam whereby imposters are posing as Recruiters from UHS, and our subsidiary hospitals and facilities. Beware of anyone requesting financial or personal information.

At UHS and all our subsidiaries, our Human Resources departments and recruiters are here to help prospective candidates by matching skill set and experience with the best possible career path at UHS and our subsidiaries. During the recruitment process, no recruiter or employee will request financial or personal information (e.g., Social Security Number, credit card or bank information, etc.) from you via email. Our recruiters will not email you from a public webmail client like Hotmail, Gmail, Yahoo Mail, etc.

If you suspect a fraudulent job posting or job-related email mentioning UHS or its subsidiaries, we encourage you to report such concerns to appropriate law enforcement. We encourage you to refer to legitimate UHS and UHS subsidiary career websites to verify job opportunities and not rely on unsolicited calls from recruiters.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Vacancy Name

Senior Data Analyst

Vacancy ID

VN2893

Location

USA - California

Created Date

5/16/2025 3:55 PM

Description

This is a key role in supporting our sales and operations through actionable data insights, technical support, and strategic analysis.

Key Responsibilities

Reporting & Metrics
• Develop, maintain, and enhance dashboards and reports to monitor key sales and operational metrics.
• Deliver regular and ad hoc reporting for various business units, with a focus on Customer Support and Data Verification KPIs.
• Ensure data accuracy and consistency across reporting platforms.
Data Analysis & Insights
• Analyze sales and operational data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for performance improvement.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Business Intelligence Tools
• Design and manage dashboards in Tableau and/or Power BI to visualize data and communicate findings.
• Utilize advanced Excel skills for data modelling, pivot tables, macros, and complex formulas.
Technical Support (Zendesk)
• Provide Level 1 technical support for Zendesk platform users, including troubleshooting issues, managing user accounts, and routing tickets.
• Collaborate with IT and vendor support as needed for escalated issues.

Ad Hoc Reporting
• Execute custom reporting and data extraction tasks as required by management or business units.
• Analyze and interpret Veritas data to support strategic initiatives and operational improvements.

Qualifications

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.

Person Specification

Knowledge, Skills and Experience
• 5+ years of experience in a data analyst or business intelligence role, preferably in a tech-focused or operational environment.
• Strong technical background with hands-on experience in database management and software tools.
• Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, macros, VLOOKUP, advanced formulas).
• Proficiency in Tableau and/or Power BI for dashboard creation and data visualization.
• Experience with Zendesk support system preferred.
• Strong problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds. We foster a diverse and inclusive culture that empowers staff to grow and maximise their skills in an environment free from all forms of inequality.

Our benefits packages vary from country to country dependant but we aim to provide flexible and competitive benefits that support individual financial, physical health and mental wellbeing. Some examples include:
• Pension or retirement benefits
• Health insurance cover
• Paid Annual Leave / PTO
• Charity / Volunteering Day
• Family friendly policies
• Flexible working practices (dependent upon role and location)
• Health & Wellbeing initiatives

When you apply for a role with Achilles, we collect and process your personal data as described in out recruitment privacy notice

title: Insight Global
description:
Insight Global is looking for a Data Analyst for a large casino client in Las Vegas, Nevada. This person will be responsible for troubleshooting data in internal dashboards, performing QA on the data/dashboards, utilizing background knowledge in data engineering to enhance data/dashboard views and complete any other ad hoc tasks for the Digital Products team.

We are a company committed to creating diverse and inclusive environments where people can bring their full, authentic selves to work every day. We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer that believes everyone matters. title: Financial Data Analyst
description:
About the Role

We’re seeking a Financial Data Analyst who’s eager to do more than just analyze data. This is a unique opportunity to work cross-functionally in a fast-growing real estate and lending startup where you’ll begin by partnering closely with loan operations—gaining a hands-on understanding of the lending process, underwriting logic, and borrower behavior. As you grow in the role, you’ll progressively shift focus toward building the financial and data models that drive decision-making at the highest levels of the business.

This role is ideal for someone who’s curious, proactive, and excited to solve real-world problems with data. You’ll work at the intersection of operations, finance, and product—translating raw data into strategic models and scalable tools.

Key Responsibilities

1. Cross-Functional Collaboration
• Engage cross-functionally with loan operations, underwriting, compliance, and capital markets to understand processes, data touchpoints, and pain points.
• Partner with stakeholders across functions to align business logic with modeling assumptions.
• Support the development of standardized data sources, reporting structures, and performance metrics across departments.

2. Data Analysis & Insights
• Analyze large datasets to uncover trends in borrower behavior, loan performance, property values, and fund-level dynamics.
• Identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and assist in ongoing monitoring of business health across business sectors.
• Build internal dashboards and visualizations to support decision-making and ensure transparency across teams.

3. Financial & Risk Modeling
• Build and maintain models to assess borrower risk, loan default probability, and overall portfolio exposure.
• Develop pricing models based on borrower profiles, LTV/CLTV ratios, and property types to support loan structuring and profitability.
• Conduct research on real estate markets to understand trends in home values, rents, and regional demand.
• Analyze how changes in market conditions (e.g., interest rates, property prices) impact loan and fund performance.
• Work with underwriting and capital markets teams to apply risk and pricing insights to product strategy and investment decisions.

4. Tools & Automation
• Collaborate with product and engineering to automate repetitive workflows and embed logic into technology tools.
• Help build scalable tools that enable underwriters, operators, and capital markets teams to make faster, more consistent decisions.
• Continuously refine internal tools based on user feedback and model performance.

5. Strategic Leadership & Investor Support
• Partner with leadership on critical strategic and investor-facing initiatives:
• Investor reporting: Prepare fund performance summaries, data visualizations, and disclosures for capital providers and stakeholders.
• Valuation modeling: Support loan and fund-level valuation using cash flow models, scenario inputs, and risk-adjusted return metrics.
• Stress testing: Simulate economic downturns or market shocks (e.g., interest rate spikes, borrower defaults, real estate price drops) to evaluate financial resilience.
• Board and investor materials: Contribute to the creation of pitch decks, performance memos, and data narratives that support capital raising and strategic planning.

Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field.
• 1–2 years of experience in a financial analyst, data analyst, or risk modeling role—experience in real estate, mortgage, or private credit is highly preferred.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a rigorous attention to detail.
• A relentless curiosity for all things data, paired with a drive to uncover the ‘why’ behind every pattern and phenomenon.
• Must possess the ability to collaborate with team members in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, contributing to a cohesive and results-driven culture.

Why This Role is Different

This is not a traditional data analyst role focused only on reporting and dashboards. You will:
• Start with hands-on business exposure to loan operations and underwriting processes.
• Progress into building the financial and analytical backbone of the company.
• Work cross-functionally with leadership, gaining a strategic view of fund management, capital markets, and investor dynamics.
• Contribute to real-time decision-making, helping scale the data infrastructure of a high-growth fintech startup.

Join Us

If you're ready to take ownership of impactful, data-driven work—and want to develop your career in a role that combines operations, analytics, and financial modeling—this is your opportunity to build something meaningful.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $54,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• Paid time off

Application Question(s):
• Kindly include a portfolio featuring projects you’ve undertaken in academic settings, during professional work, or preferably, those pursued out of personal interest and curiosity.

Location:
• Alhambra, CA 91801 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:
• Alhambra, CA 91801: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Salesforce Data Analyst
description:
Summary

A dynamic opportunity for a skilled Data Analyst to drive data architecture improvements, optimize reporting, and support business intelligence initiatives. This role centers on data analysis and threat detection within Salesforce, ensuring system performance, security, and efficient API usage.

Key Responsibilities
• Collaborate with internal and external subject matter experts to develop and maintain operational reports in Salesforce, Power BI, and Excel.
• Assist in the implementation and maintenance of log analytics infrastructure for enhanced data tracking.
• Define key event-capture metrics and create relevant reporting solutions.
• Design and maintain efficient queries to support data-driven decision-making.
• Conduct ad-hoc analysis, manipulating data as needed to uncover insights.
• Troubleshoot and resolve data source issues with minimal supervision.

Required Skills & Experience
• Salesforce Sales Cloud expertise (2+ years required) - hands-on experience with configuring, reporting, and analyzing Salesforce data.
• Strong proficiency in T-SQL (3+ years) - including window functions, CTEs, views, and stored procedures.
• Experience managing data import/export workflows (3+ years).
• Advanced Power BI / DAX skills (2+ years) for building impactful visualizations and analytics.
• Expert-level Excel knowledge, including Power Query for data transformation.
• Ability to work independently, take ownership of tasks, and communicate effectively.
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience with third-party log analytics platforms.
• Knowledge of Python / VBA for data automation.
• Familiarity with Git / Azure DevOps version control.
• Exposure to Salesforce Marketing Cloud for extended CRM insights.

title: Senior Data Analyst (Data Scientist / Data Engineer)
description:
The Senior Data Analyst leads enterprise-level data initiatives by combining technical expertise
with strategic insight. This role is responsible for driving data governance, advanced analytics,
integration projects, and dashboard development to support the organization's mission - including
initiatives in affordable housing and enterprise-wide operations. The ideal candidate is a seasoned
data professional with strong leadership skills, hands-on technical ability, and a passion for
delivering data-driven insights.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Lead and manage cross-functional data governance, migration, integration, and analytics projects
aligned with strategic organizational goals.
• Design and implement robust dashboards and visualizations using Power BI, ensuring clarity,
performance, and data accuracy.
• Write, optimize, and maintain complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and
reporting across multiple platforms.
• Develop and enforce data governance standards, policies, and best practices across
departments.
• Integrate with external APIs and enterprise systems to support real-time data ingestion and
analysis.
• Mentor junior analysts, fostering a culture of growth, collaboration, and analytical
excellence.
• Translate complex data into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical
stakeholders.
• Manage project timelines, stakeholder expectations, and reporting deliverables across business
units.

SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
• Proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling (DAX, M language), report design, and
performance tuning.
• Experience with dashboarding and data storytelling to communicate trends and opportunities
effectively.
• SQL development skills with the ability to query and manipulate large datasets.
• Familiarity with RESTful APIs and integrating external data sources into enterprise
systems.
• Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving capabilities.
• Demonstrated leadership in managing analytics initiatives and cross-functional
collaboration.
• Knowledge of data warehousing, data modeling, and ETL/ELT processes.
• Effective communicator with the ability to explain technical concepts clearly to non-technical
audiences.

EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION
• Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, or related
field.
• 5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or data engineering.
• Advanced Excel skills preferred.
• Experience working with ERP systems for data integration and enterprise reporting.
• Project Management experience a plus.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORK ENVIRONMENT
• Operate computer and office equipment.
• Work is primarily sedentary in nature.

FLSA:
• Exempt

PAY

$100,000 to $115,000/year

title: Online Data Analyst- Remote Work
description:
Online Data Analyst - Remote Work

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community
Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

Qualification path
No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements
• Full Professional Proficiency in English language
• Being a resident of United States for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in the United States
• Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
• Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
• Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment:
In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

title: Data & Decision Analyst, Senior
description:
Your Role

The Blue Shield of California Growth and Servicing analytics organization is part of the centralized Data and Analytics organization and oversees Channel Analytics including Digital, Marketing, Claims, Appeals, Grievances, Disputes and Line of Business. The Medical Informatics Analyst – Senior ( Individual Family Plan) will report to the Senior Manager of Medical Informatics and play a critical role in advancing the health plan’s specialty lines of business (dental, vision, and life insurance). This role is strategically designed to focus 70% on analytics and 30% on reporting, emphasizing the use of machine learning models and predictive analytics to drive member acquisition, retention, engagement, and growth, as well as identifying opportunities for cross-selling.

The successful candidate will have a robust understanding of both medical benefits, a proven ability to leverage existing analytics solutions across benefit types, and a demonstrated capacity to improve operational efficiency through data integration and actionable insights. Passionate about improving member health outcomes through data and analytics, the candidate will actively engage with stakeholders to frame business problems, recommend analytic frameworks, and deliver impactful, high-quality solutions.

A product-oriented mindset and the ability to influence outcomes in a matrixed environment are essential to excel in this role.

Your Work

In this role you will:
• Integrate medical benefits data with other BSC data, creating comprehensive employer reports that identify cross-selling opportunities and improve member experiences.
• Lead the development and deployment of machine learning models to predict and enhance member acquisition, retention, engagement, and growth within the dental and vision lines of business.
• Perform predictive and prescriptive analytics to understand member behavior, identify intervention opportunities, and recommend strategies for growth and retention.
• Collaborate with Individual Family Plan Line of Business (LOB) teams to align business goals with analytics solutions and deliver data-driven recommendations.
• Support regulatory reporting and monthly employer reporting by working closely with the data services team to develop integrated data models spanning medical, dental, and vision benefits.
• Partner with data engineering teams to ensure seamless integration of claims data from multiple sources into the analytics environment.
• Analyze structured and unstructured data to uncover pain points, establish causality, and recommend prioritized solutions based on insights.
• Build intuitive reports and dashboards to empower stakeholders with data-driven decision-making tools.
• Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, engagement strategies, and product performance using actionable insights.
• Assist in defining strategic business rules and KPIs for reporting and analytics within the specialty benefits domain.
• Be enthusiastic about solving complex challenges, improving member satisfaction, and driving health outcomes.
• Thrive in a matrixed environment, balancing priorities across teams and stakeholders.
• Approach problems with curiosity, creativity, and a solutions-driven mindset.
• Passionate about improving member outcomes while delivering value to the organization.

Your Knowledge and Experience
• Bachelor’s degree in data science, health informatics, statistics, mathematics, economics, engineering or related quantitative fields. Master’s degree preferred
• Minimum 5 years of prior relevant experience, and 3 years’ experience in Health Care (managed care, academic, or gov't payer)
• 3+ years working with Claims and Membership, or similar data strongly preferred.
• Strongly preferred working knowledge of Snowflake, Databricks, RDBMS (Oracle, Netezza etc.)
• Advanced Python, SQL SAS or equivalent skills to interact with data
• Strong experience with machine learning techniques such as classification, clustering, and predictive modeling, especially in member engagement and retention contexts
• Experience with medical claims data integration and analysis.
• Proven ability to integrate and analyze medical claims data, providing actionable insights for employer groups and internal stakeholders.
• Familiarity with cross-selling strategies and member engagement techniques in the healthcare space
• Hands-on Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to present insights in a clear and actionable manner.
• Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with the Individual Family Plan LOB team and align analytics initiatives with business strategy
• Demonstrated ability to partner across all levels of staff and adapt quickly to shifting priorities.

ABOUT THE TEAM
About Stellarus and the Ascendiun Family of Companies

Stellarus, launched in January 2025, is designed to scale innovative healthcare solutions that support customers in creating a health care experience deserving of their family, friends, and neighbors.

Stellarus is part of a family of organizations that is overseen by a nonprofit corporate entity named Ascendiun. The Ascendiun Family of Companies also includes Blue Shield of California and its subsidiary, Blue Shield of California Promise Health Plan and Altais, a clinical services company.

Stellarus’ vision is to empower its customers to create a healthcare experience that is worthy of their family, friends, and neighbors. Stellarus’ objective is to offer innovative, modern, scalable solutions that challenge the health care status quo. This very closely aligns with Blue Shield of California’s vision by using innovation to improve quality, affordability, and experience for members.

To achieve our mission, we foster an environment where all employees can thrive and contribute fully to address the needs of the various communities we serve. We are committed to creating and maintaining a supportive workplace that upholds our values and advances our goals.

Our Values:

At Stellarus, our core values of agility, trust, drive, courage and service shape our approach to developing innovative product offerings.

Our Workplace Model:

At Stellarus and the Ascendiun Family of Companies, we believe in fostering a workplace environment that balances purposeful in-person collaboration with flexibility. As we continue to evolve our workplace model, our focus remains on creating spaces where our people can connect with purpose – whether working in the office or through a hybrid approach – by providing clear expectations while respecting the diverse needs of our workforce.

Two Ways of Working:
• Hybrid (Default): Work from a business unit-approved office at least two (2) times per month (for roles below Director-level) or once per week (for Director-level roles and above). Exceptions:

o Member-facing and approved out-of-state roles remain remote.

o Employees living more than 50 miles from their assigned offices are expected to work with their managers on a plan for periodic office visits.

o For employees with medical conditions that may impact their ability to work in-office, we are committed to engaging in an interactive process and providing reasonable accommodations to ensure their work environment is conducive to their success and well-being.
• On-Site: Work from a business unit-approved office an average of four (4) or more days a week.

Physical Requirements:

Office Environment - roles involving part to full time schedule in Office Environment. Based in our physical offices and work from home office/deskwork - Activity level: Sedentary, frequency most of work day.

Equal Employment Opportunity:

External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Qualified applicants with arrest records and/or conviction records will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with Federal, State and local laws, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability status and any other classification protected by Federal, State and local laws.

title: Data Analyst II
description:
Koam Engineering Systems, Inc. (KES Inc.) is an employee-owned small business specializing in technology innovation and systems integration by combining innovative products and reliable engineering services. Headquartered in San Diego, California and with offices in Gig Harbor, WA KES provides services globally in systems engineering & technical assistance, requirements analysis, software design & development, systems integration & testing, independent verification & validation, and operational & logistic support.

JOB PURPOSE

To support PEO Front Office in the generation, processing, routing and maintenance of Ship Change Documents.

JOB RESPONSIBILITY SUMMARY
• Maintain Ship Change Document (SCD) metrics data points, such as submission dates, alt types, review timelines, common errors, for completion of ad-hoc metrics requests.
• Provide technical instruction and guidance regarding SCD processes: Including database operation, SCD completion guidance, the review process, approval timeline and typical setbacks, and its relationship to the overall installation process.
• Assist program offices in accurately completing the SCD forms with associated CBA for NDE submission of alterations, Engineering Changes, Field Changes, and Temporary alterations.
• Review SCDs for NDE-EP submission in accordance with the NMP Management and Operations Manual (NMP-MOM) and customer-driven requirements.
• Identify discrepancies, correct, and resubmit SCDs returned by the Technical Assessment Team, CBA reviewer, and Resource Sponsor for additional comments.
• Collect data and provide user feedback via meetings and conversations with key personnel involved with ongoing NMP SCD development and review procedures.
• Interface between various NAVSEA agencies and the NAVWAR PMWs, ISEAs, SPAWAR PEO C4I, Planning Yards and SSC SD Ship Sup personnel relative to ongoing SHIPALT design issues.
• Provide Estimated Completion Dates of pending SCDs for installation planning purposes and metrics briefings.
• Create and update SCD ID and Alteration Records within the SPIDER database and the database requirements within NDE.Net
• Support Advanced Planning and Execution, including comparison of planned installations indicated on the CBA and Advanced Consolidated Fielding Plan (ACFP) to current CNO avail schedules to scheduled jobs in SPIDER, ensuring plans and schedules align.
• Gather SCD and fielding plan data, including maturity, accuracy against the current schedules, and estimated completion dates for use in the advanced planners' monthly risk assessment meeting.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES

(To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and ability required.)

EDUCATION/LICENSURE/CREDENTIALS

Required:
• High School Diploma
• This position requires an existing U.S. Government DoD granted security clearance/eligibility at the final Secret level. Individuals must be able to maintain the required security clearance/eligibility for continued employment. U.S. Citizenship is required.
• Job Located at a U.S. Government Facility

Preferred:
• Some college or BA/BS degree

EXPERIENCE

Required:
• Two (2) years' experience working in a DoD, Military, or government agency environment..

Preferred:
• Experience with Navy Modernization Process (NMP) and Navy Data Environment-Entitled Process (NDE-EP) as applicable to SCD development, management, review and approval requirements.

Special Knowledge/Skills

Preferred:
• Navy Data Environment-Entitled Process (NDE-EP); SPIDER/NDE Alteration work flow

Since 1995, KES continues to foster the entrepreneurial spirit of a growing small business that focuses on the needs of its customers and employees and serves to provide a rewarding and challenging career. KES offers a competitive salary and full range of benefits. KES, Inc. is an EEO/AA Employer committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce.

Equal Opportunity Employer – minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity.

title: Azure Data Analyst (2) - 5770313
description:
Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.

As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.

You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.

Job Description:

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for reviewing and mapping data elements between systems, preparing technical documents, and identifying data gaps. You will collaborate closely with various teams to convert business requirements into technical specifications and write queries to profile data in cloud platforms and databases.Responsibilities:

+ Review source and destination data stores and map the data elements between two systems.

+ Prepare and maintain technical documents such as Source to Target Mapping (STTM), design documents.

+ Identify the current data gaps and create documentation with details.

+ Write mapping documents that will help the data engineers and testers to build and test data pipelines.

+ Identify the new source system based on client's direction and roadmap.

+ Work effectively and in close collaboration with different teams.

+ Ability to convert business requirements to technical requirements.

+ Able to write queries independently to profile data in the Cloud Platform & Databases.

Basic Qualifications:

+ Minimum of 3 years of experience with Azure Data Analytics

Preferred Qualifications:

+ STTM Source to Target Mapping

+ Requirements Analysis

+ Banking industry experience

+ Stakeholder engagement

+ Azure Boards

+ SQL application development experience using Angular

+ Bachelor's or Associate's degree

Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Illinois, Maryland, Minnesota, New York, New Jersey or Washington as set forth below. We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply. Information on benefits is here. (https://www.accenture.com/us-en/careers/local/total-rewards)

Role Location:

California - $40.96 - $50.96

Colorado - $40.96 - $50.96

District of Columbia - $40.96 - $50.96

Illinois - $40.96 - $50.96

Minnesota - $40.96 - $50.96

Maryland - $40.96 - $50.96

New York/New Jersey - $40.96 - $50.96

Washington - $40.96 - $50.96

#LI-NA-FY25

What We Believe

We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.

Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here (https://www.accenture.com/us-en/about/inclusion-diversity/us-workforce)

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation.

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement (https://www.accenture.com/content/dam/accenture/final/accenture-com/document/Annual-Policy-Statement-Regarding-EEO-2023-Applicant.pdf#zoom=50) .

Requesting An Accommodation

Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.

If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email (https://www.accenture.com/us-en/about/contact-us) or speak with your recruiter.

Other Employment Statements

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Company Description

POLY Consulting Inc. is a market growth consultancy that helps businesses recalibrate their marketplace and workplace strategy. Born out of a business heritage in multicultural communications, POLY was founded on the idea that previously proven, traditional playbooks are waning in efficacy, and out-of-step with today’s market. We understand the complexities of a diverse U.S. consumer base fusing deep knowledge and cultural attunement with pragmatic solutions that impact market growth of new and next generation consumers.

POLY is part of a privately owned holding company with blue chip clients.

Job Description

Based in Huntington Beach, CA, we are looking for an entry-level, full-time team member to support our strategists and senior leaders with data-driven insights and presentations. This is a full-time in-office position. Compensation is $65,000 to $75,000 annually.

In this role, you’ll learn how to use marketplace research tools and develop the analytical foundation needed for a career in strategy, consulting, or marketing. You will work closely with senior team members and be a key contributor in developing insights that shape client growth strategies.

Qualifications

These skills will be needed to do the job:
• A degree in Statistics, Computer Science or similar fields
• Strong analytical and research skills
• Proficiency in advanced Excel (modeling, analysis, dashboards) Skills & ETL processes to build multi-layered models
• Ability to assess and qualify research needs
• Clear, concise communication and presentation skills
• Ability to translate data into actionable insights and convert them into data-driven decks (PowerPoint/Keynote) to provide a point of view on the results
• Familiarity with tools like MRI/Simmons, Nielsen/IRI, Sprout Social, Claritas, Global Web Index, & Helixa
• Interest or basic knowledge of AI
• Exposure to marketing, consulting, or business strategy environments
• Experience in Python, R, SQL

Additional Information

https://www.poly-consulting.com/

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Data Analyst
description:
BillEase is hiring a Data Analyst with 0 - 3 years of experience. Based in United States - San Marino, CA and with Hybrid ways of working.

Job description and responsibilities:

Your Responsibilities Will Include
• Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytics systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks
• Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex datasets
• Evaluate organizational methods and provide source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for datasets
• Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization
• Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data
• Work directly with managers and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships
• Design and develop reports, dashboards, and visualizations to effectively present data-driven insights and trends.
• Analyze large and complex datasets using statistical techniques and data mining methods to identify patterns, correlations, and trends.
• Perform data cleansing, validation, and quality assurance to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the analysis.
• Conduct ad-hoc data analysis and generate actionable insights to support business decision-making and address specific inquiries.
• Collaborate with data engineers to ensure data availability, accuracy, and integrity by defining data collection and transformation processes.
• Develop and maintain data models, data dictionaries, and documentation to support data analysis and reporting.
• Identify opportunities for process improvements and data-driven optimizations by monitoring and evaluating key metrics and performance indicators.
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization

Requirements and qualifications:

Skills Required
• Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong understanding of data analysis techniques, methodologies, and best practices.
• Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis from relational databases, particularly PostgreSQL.
• Experience with data visualization tools and techniques, such as Tableau, Power BI, or Python libraries.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and draw actionable insights.
• Knowledge of statistical analysis and data mining techniques, such as regression analysis, clustering, and hypothesis testing.
• Familiarity with data preparation and wrangling techniques, including data cleansing, transformation, and aggregation.
• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
• Experience working with large datasets and using data querying languages or tools (e.g., SQL, Spark) is a plus.
• Knowledge and experience with additional databases, such as ClickHouse and MongoDB, for handling diverse data storage needs.
• Understanding of OLAP (Online Analytical Processing) concepts and experience with OLAP tools and technologies.
• Familiarity with data warehousing concepts, including dimensional modeling and star schema design.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present and explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders

title: Sr Business Data Analyst
description:
This role will compensate between $70,000 - $115,000.

Sr Business Data Analyst

Are you a passionate leader looking for autonomy and exciting career possibilities?Do you take an energetic and resourceful approach to problem-solving while bringing innovative ideas and analytics to life on behalf of your team and your customers?Do you enjoy effectively translating requirements into an efficient process and/or system solution? If so, DHL Supply Chain has the opportunity for you.

Job Description

To apply knowledge and analytics to develop and communicate timely, accurate, and actionable insight to the business through the use of modeling, visualization, and optimization. Responsible for the reporting, analyzing, and predicting of operational processes, performance, and Key Performance Indicators. Communication with site leadership, operations, and finance on efficiency, customer requirements, account specific issues, and insight into to the business, operations, and customer.
• Applies hindsight, insight, and foresight techniques to communicate complex findings and recommendations to influence others to take action
• Uses knowledge of business and data structure to discover and/or anticipate problems where data can be used to solve the problem
• Uses spreadsheets, databases, and relevant software to provide ongoing analysis of operational activities
• Applies data visualization for discovery and timely insights to decrease Cycle Time to Action (CTA)
• Assists site operations in identifying areas for improving service levels, reducing operational costs, and providing other operational enhancements
• Supports account start-up analysis and/or report implementation as needed
• Develop standardized and ad hoc site and/or customer reporting
• Streamlines and/or automates internal and external reporting
• May investigate and recommend new technologies and information systems
• May conduct feasibility analyses on various processes and equipment to increase efficiency of operations
• Partners with Finance to develop financial models to analyze productivity and payroll; calculates cost benefits and business impact and proposes solutions
• Develops predictive models to help drive decision making
• Designs, develops, and implements data gathering and reporting methods and procedures for Operations
• Coordinates with Operations Systems group to ensure technical issues and problems are being identified, addressed, and resolved in a timely manner
• May coordinate with ILD group on issues related to modeling customer solutions, including providing data and relevant insight for customer pursuits
• Responsible for assisting finance and senior leadership in modeling yearly labor budget based on operational and profile changes

Required Education and Experience
• Undergraduate degree in business, logistics, mathematics, statistics, related field, or equivalent experience, required
• 1+ years of analytics experience, required

Our Organization has a business casual environment and focuses on teamwork, associate development, training, and continuous improvement. We offer competitive wages, excellent affordable insurance benefits (including health, dental, vision and life), 401K plan, paid vacation and holidays.

Our Organization is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Data Analyst - AI Trainer
description:
We are looking for a data analyst to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

In this role you will need to hold an expert level of mathematical reasoning- a completed or in progress Masters/PhD is preferred but not required. Other related fields include, but are not limited to: Applied Math and/or Computer Science.

Benefits:
• This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
• You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
• You can work on your own schedule
• Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities:
• Give AI chatbots diverse and complex mathematics problems and evaluate their outputs
• Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications:
• Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
• Detail-oriented
• Proficient in mathematics, arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, probability, statistics, and inductive/ deductive reasoning
• A current, in progress, or completed Masters and/or PhD is preferred but not required

Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you.

#INDUSMA

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $40.00 per hour

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Data Analyst - HR Analytics
description:
Las Vegas, Nevada

The SHOW comes alive at MGM Resorts International

Have you ever wondered what it would be like to work in a place full of excitement, diversity, and entertainment? Are you enthusiastic about being a team player in one of the most fascinating industries in the world? At MGM Resorts, we seek individuals like YOU to create unique and show-stopping experiences for our guests.

THE JOB:

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for creating, maintaining, monitoring, and optimizing the relational SQL Server and its associated technologies like SSIS to deliver actionable analytics and insights within the HR Analytics function.

THE DAY-TO-DAY:
• Designs and develops complex data transformations used within analytical databases, operational reporting, and dashboards using various tools.
• Executes complex hypothesis testing, data mining, and model development to solve complex problems, under the guidance of HR Analytics leadership.
• Develops and maintains architecture of databases (i.e. tables, procedures, ETLs, etc.), along with data warehouse.
• Designs and develops performant and resilient database objects in SQL Server (SSMS).
• Extracts, compiles, and cleans HR data from Workday, SQL server, and various other sources.
• Design and implement dashboards and other data visualizations that present data in a meaningful and actionable way.
• Analyzes issues independently, uses judgement to make decisions, and takes necessary action.
• Partners with Director of HR Analytics to implement strategic initiatives and special projects.
• Ensures high internal customer satisfaction in accordance with MGM Resorts service standards.
• Analyzes and documents how the business requirements fit into existing system and provides recommendations.
• Maintains a solid understanding of the Company's goals and objectives.
• Actively seeks out new opportunities to optimize capabilities while considering down-stream impact and ensuring data integrity.
• Provides data analysis for a variety of needs to better inform decision-making; effectively communicates the narrative of the data, including trends and/or incongruities.
• Partners with business stakeholders to understand their requests and ensures a solution that meets their needs.
• Follows established service standards and procedures while ensuring that deadlines are met within time frames and quality expectations.
• Strong aptitude for quickly troubleshooting and identifying the cause of questionable results within extracts and reports.
• Demonstrated business analyst experience; communicating effectively with business clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative solutions.
• Analyzes issues independently, uses judgement to make decisions, and takes necessary action.
• Perform other job-related duties as requested

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Management, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics,

Economics, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• 3+ years experience creating dashboards and visualizations, writing SQL server code
• 3+ years of relevant experience with SSIS
• Experience providing Human Resources reporting and analytics insights preferred.
• Experience in the Healthcare environment (Eligibility, Claims, Providers) preferred.
• Strong attention to detail and analytical thinking
• Experience communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences
• Ability to work independently and manage projects from start to finish

THE PERKS & BENEFITS:
• Prioritize your wellness, access programs crafted to nurture your mental and physical health.
• Enjoy unbeatable discounts on hotel stays, dining, retail, entertainment, and exclusive partner perks for travel, tech, and beyond!
• Savor delicious meals for free in our employee dining room.
• Park with ease-whether you're on or off shift, it's free!
• From healthcare to financial support and generous time-off options, we've got you covered.
• Elevate your career with development programs, connect through networking events, and make a difference with community volunteer opportunities.

VIEW JOB DESCRIPTION:

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Who We Are

2K is headquartered in Novato, California and is a wholly owned label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO). Founded in 2005, 2K Games is a global video game company, publishing titles developed by some of the most influential game development studios in the world. Our studios responsible for developing 2K’s portfolio of world-class games across multiple platforms include Visual Concepts, Firaxis, Hangar 13, CatDaddy, Cloud Chamber, 31st Union, HB Studios, and 2K SportsLab. Our portfolio of titles is expanding due to our global strategic plan, building and acquiring exciting studios whose content continues to inspire all of us! 2K publishes titles in today’s most popular gaming genres, including sports, shooters, action, role-playing, strategy, casual, and family entertainment.

Our team of engineers, marketers, artists, writers, data scientists, producers, thinkers, and doers are the professional publishing stewards of 2K’s portfolio, which currently includes several AAA, sports, and entertainment brands, including global powerhouse NBA️ 2K, renowned BioShock️, Borderlands️, Mafia, Sid Meier’s Civilization️, and XCOM️ brands; popular WWE️ 2K and WWE️ SuperCard franchises, TopSpin 2K25, as well as the critically and commercially acclaimed PGA TOUR️ 2K.

At 2K, we pride ourselves on creating an inclusive work environment, which means encouraging our teams to Come as You Are and do your best work! We encourage ALL applicants to explore our global positions, even if they don’t meet every requirement for the role. If you're interested in the job and think you have what it takes to work at 2K, we encourage you to apply!
Who We Are Looking For

We are seeking a skilled and passionate Senior Data Analyst to join our talented Insights and Analytics team in developing and refining data-informed approaches to drive player and live services strategy for an emerging IP in the 2K portfolio.

The ideal candidate demonstrates a strong understanding of game telemetry and the valuable insights it provides to guide product development and shape key business decisions. The candidate excels at translating business objectives into analytical and telemetry requirements, fostering effective collaboration with product, monetization, and marketing teams to develop data-driven solutions for live services and commercial business decisions. Additionally, the right candidate will feel comfortable developing new metrics and crafting automated reports through the utilization of various analytical tools and techniques, all tailored to address the unique needs of our studio and publishing partners. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a proactive problem-solving approach and exhibit highly effective cross-disciplinary communication skills.
What You Will Do
• Partner with Data Engineers, Data QA, and Central tech teams to inform telemetry requirements and ensure the delivery of high-quality data required to enable analysis and business reporting.
• Collaborate with our player insights team to define telemetry requirements that will enable player-focused product testing and player feedback analysis.
• Analyze player in-game telemetry and player feedback data by utilizing statistical techniques to extract key actionable insights.
• Provide definitions for metrics and create aggregations used for reporting and analysis.
• Utilize analytical tools such as DataBricks or Tableau to create automated reports, compelling visualizations, and dashboards to track performance trends and strategic insights.
• Mentor and support junior-level Data Analysts on the team.
What Will Make a Great Fit
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.
• 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst with a focus on product development driven by the player experience.
• Strong attention to detail with the ability to monitor data accuracy and reliability throughout the various phases of the data pipeline.
• Experience leveraging analytical, quantitative, and business judgment skills to maximize the utilization of game telemetry to inform product and player strategy.
• Strong expertise in relational databases, SQL (experience with Snowflake, Databricks).
• Hands-on experience with programming languages like Python or R and familiarity with data analysis libraries, such as Pandas, NumPy, and Plotly.
• Strong data storytelling skills and visualization experience.
• Experience with project management and communication tools such as Asana, Confluence, JIRA, and Slack.

As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to ensuring that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform their essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us if you need reasonable accommodation.

The pay range for this position in California at the start of employment is expected to be between $87,400 and $129,340 per Year. However, base pay offered is based on market location and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an 'at-will position' and the company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation or benefit program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.
