title: Quality Data Analyst - USDS
description:
Responsibilities

Trust and Safety Operations a pivotal team within U.S. Data Security. We strive to enable TikTok to become the most trusted and secure platform in the US through operational excellence in content moderation via innovations in technology, optimization in processes and investment in people. We ensure that we enforce our policies based on our community guidelines and we take appropriate actions in a timely manner to minimize risks on our platform to our users and advertisers.

As a Quality Data Analyst within TikTok's USDS Training and Quality team reporting to the Quality Manager, you will be a key member of our Trust and Safety operations. In this role, you will:
- Empower Decision-Making: Own and maintain data systems and dashboards, ensuring that QA results are accurate and readily available as vital business intelligence for both internal and external teams.
- Drive Quality Processes: Execute high-quality audit processes and deliver actionable insights to stakeholders, contributing to continuous quality program enhancements.
- Conduct In-Depth Analyses: Perform system-wide root cause analyses (RCA) for Trust and Safety moderation queues and manage data validation processes to identify and address areas for improvement.
- Lead Data Management: Take charge of the quality team's data management, ensuring robust data integrity that supports strategic decision-making across the organization.
This role combines technical expertise with a strong analytical mindset, making you a key driver in enhancing our Trust and Safety initiatives.

In order to enhance collaboration and cross-functional partnerships, among other things, at this time, our organization follows a hybrid work schedule that requires employees to work in the office 3 days a week, or as directed by their manager/department. We regularly review our hybrid work model, and the specific requirements may change at any time.

Responsibilities:
- Own and maintain backend data systems ensuring data quality, accuracy, and consistency across multiple sources.
- Design, build, and maintain intuitive dashboards and data tables that monitor key trust and safety metrics, enabling proactive issue detection and decision-making.
- Develop, document, and continually refine data-related processes and workflows; ensure data processes align with broader trust and safety strategies.
- Conduct deep-dive analyses to identify trends, anomalies, and actionable insights; communicate findings to cross-functional teams to drive strategic improvements.
- Partner with crossfunctional teams to ensure data solutions support operational needs
- Support in the implementation of audits and monitoring systems to uphold data integrity and support adherence to moderation accuracy
- Provide timely insights through reports and analyses on Accuracy trends and performance

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
- 3+ years experience in Trust & Safety, or similar industry experience
- Experience creating analysis reports and conducting RCAs
- Creative, solution-oriented mindset with the ability to execute under pressure and meet deadlines
- Able to work with minimal supervision, taking ownership of work and completing tasks in a timely manner, while adapting rapidly to changing work environments, priorities and organizational needs
- Ability to provide data driven analysis to cross functional teams in various processes, policies, and procedures
- SQL skills for querying and manipulating large datasets.
- Experience with dashboarding and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI).

Preferred Qualifications
- Great at working cross-functionally with other teams/departments
- Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
- At least 3 years of people management skills
- Direct experience conducting research and analyzing data to gain insights into the business

Wellbeing Statement
Trust & Safety recognizes that keeping our platform safe for TikTok communities is no ordinary job. It can be rewarding, psychologically demanding, and emotionally taxing. This is why we are sharing the potential hazards, risks and implications in this unique line of work from the start: so our candidates are well informed before proceeding.

We are committed to the wellbeing of all our employees and promise to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach.

Job Information

[For Pay Transparency] Compensation Description (annually)

The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $83600 - $135111 annually.

Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate's qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.

Benefits may vary depending on the nature of employment and the country work location. Employees have day one access to medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) savings plan with company match, paid parental leave, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, wellbeing benefits, among others. Employees also receive 10 paid holidays per year, 10 paid sick days per year and 17 days of Paid Personal Time (prorated upon hire with increasing accruals by tenure).

The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.

For Los Angeles County (unincorporated) Candidates:

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws including the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. Our company believes that criminal history may have a direct, adverse and negative relationship on the following job duties, potentially resulting in the withdrawal of the conditional offer of employment:

1. Interacting and occasionally having unsupervised contact with internal/external clients and/or colleagues;

2. Appropriately handling and managing confidential information including proprietary and trade secret information and access to information technology systems; and

3. Exercising sound judgment.

title: Sr. Business Data Analyst (open to remote!)
description:
Location: Dallas, Texas

Employment Type: Regular

Team: Strategy

Reporting into the Chief Strategy Officer of Match Group, the Strategy and Analytics team is a nimble team that supports senior leaders and our portfolio businesses across Match Group on their most important strategic initiatives and challenges.

As a Sr. Business Data Analyst, you will extract critical data from multiple data sources and use your deep technical skills to develop reporting deliverables. Additionally, you will translate data into insights and actionable recommendations.
• **We’re based in Dallas, TX. However, we are open to considering a remote office for a highly qualified candidate who can travel periodically to Dallas (when safe to do so)***
How you’ll make an impact:
• You will develop a deep understanding of our products and businesses and their associated data.
• You will understand how metrics are defined and stored across multiple data sources and effectively combine them to enable custom reporting across Match Group portfolio businesses.
• You will succinctly and persuasively communicate your findings and make recommendations – anything from informing long-term product roadmaps to responding to competitive pressures.
• You will lead projects to continuously improve our data and reporting capabilities (e.g. proactively suggesting and building new reporting, fine-tuning and automating existing reporting, etc.).

We could be a match if:
• You have a strong blend of both technical and functional professional analytical experience and are business-minded. You need to be able to "tell the story".
• You have 2-8 years of professional experience in SQL (T-SQL and/or Redshift preferred) and at least 2 years of experience in a data/business analytics role.
• You are proficient in Excel including analyzing datasets and synthesizing findings via Pivot tables and charts.
• You have passion and analytical chops for developing and analyzing large, complex datasets and translating them into actionable insights.
• Your verbal and written communication skills are excellent, and you can effectively tailor your communication of insights to specific audiences.
• You have experience creating executive-facing PowerPoint presentations.
• You have completed an undergraduate degree in a technical or quantitative field (bonus if you have an MSBA degree).
• *Applicants will be required to complete a SQL skills assessment.

What’s the team like?
• The members of the Strategy and Analytics team are passionate about using data to find solutions to challenges across our organization.
• In this role, you will report to the Director, Strategy & Analytics, and work with leaders and stakeholders across all the Match Group products.

#LI-REMOTE

Why Match Group?

Our mission is simple – to help people find love and happiness! We love our employees too – here are some examples how:

Annual training budget for each employee
100% employer match on 401k contributions
Specific COVID-19 allowance for home office set-up
Matched giving to qualified organizations
100% paid Parental Leave for up to 20 weeks
Happy Hours and Company events

At Match Group, we represent a collection of unique brands - but we all focus together on the health and safety of all of our employees. That's why we require that employees are fully-vaccinated when in person at any US office or company-sponsored fun. If you need to talk through this in-person vaccine requirement, our People team can work with you through our accommodations review process.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we value the rich dynamics that diversity brings to our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sexual orientation, sex (including pregnancy and sexual harassment), gender identity or expression, uniformed service or veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. Period.

title: Clinical Data Analyst
description:
Job Details

Job Location: Los Angeles, CA

Salary Range: $75000.00 - $90000.00 Salary

Description

Clinical Data Analyst

Job description The Healthcare Data Analyst supports Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set (HEDIS) and Uniform Data Systems (UDS) quality and process improvement activities by producing healthcare outcome measurements used for internal and external reporting. Tasks include data quality assurance, process programming, specification documentation, and report development. The Healthcare Data Analyst applies technical skills to design, develop, and generate data analytics using time management tools that may evolve into complex data analysis and data integration projects, for which this individual may be responsible for maintaining and storing. The complex data analysis/integration projects are those which may require periodic maintenance on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, biannual, or annual basis. This position takes basic instructions or specifications and interviews with the internal clients for complete details sufficient for writing data queries based on ad hoc and ongoing health care measures. This position must understand the relationships between field elements in encounters and claims, as well as membership and provider databases. This position is a key resource to the Quality Performance Management (QPM) department on application use. This position supports the functions related to quality improvement activities, inclusive of quarterly reports that demonstrate healthcare outcomes in comparison to targets or national averages/percentiles published by recognized organizations such as the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) and the Center for Disease Control (CDC). Acts as a Subject Matter Expert and serves as a resource and educator for other staff. Responsibilities •This individual contributor is primarily responsible for assisting the Quality and Leadership team in supporting data-informed decisions, assisting with data and information gathering for targeted variables in an established systematic fashion, and assisting with data preparation for analytic efforts under the guidance of the Chief Medical Information Officer •This position assists with the execution of creative data analytic approaches leading to actionable outcomes and assists with data analysis interpretation under the guidance of Quality Director and Senior Leadership •Pursues self-development and effective relationships with others by sharing information with coworkers and customers; listening and responding to performance feedback; acknowledging strengths and weaknesses; and adapting to and learning from change, difficulties, and feedback •Completes work assignments by following procedures and policies and using data, and resources; collaborating with others to address business problems; adhering to established priorities, deadlines, and expectations; communicating progress and information to the Chief Medical Information Officer •Supports data-informed decisions under the guidance of Quality Director and Senior Leadership by assisting in the development of outcomes and process measures; documenting business requirements; adhering to data/information needs and data collection methods; supporting the measurement of impact of business decisions on clients, customers, and/or members; supporting end-users; and documenting processes and deliverables

•Assists with data and information gathering for targeted variables in an established systematic fashion by cleaning and organizing data; querying, merging, and extracting data across sources; completing routine data refresh and update; and providing user support and documentation •Assists with data preparation for analytic efforts under the guidance of Quality Director and Leadership Team by cleaning data to ensure quality and accuracy based on provided guidelines; and consolidating data •Assists with data analysis interpretation under the guidance of Quality Director and Leadership Team by organizing reports and presentations telling a compelling story to stakeholders to enable and influence decision making

• Assists with data analysis education for senior staff, clinic managers and staff that conducts regular data reports

Qualifications

Qualifications

Education:

•In lieu of a degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered

•Master's Degree in Public Health or Related analytics fields

Experience:

•5+ years of experience working with healthcare products and data, having directly worked with claims data, patient data, and other health-related data sets

•5+ years of professional experience as a healthcare data analyst or healthcare data engineer

•Must be able to apply and/or develop technical specifications for health care measures such as those used by the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA), HEDIS, UDS

•Must demonstrate advanced skills in developing programs and procedures for analytics and quality assurance

•Must be able to present data in a format that is appropriate for analysis

•Must demonstrate an aptitude for learning and expanding abilities to use new applications with basic training

•Must be a self-starter and can multi-task and take charge of assigned projects

•Proficiency in writing clean and maintainable SQL, Python, and shell scripts for automation, analysis,

industry best practices

•Deep knowledge of data security to protect highly confidential and sensitive data, especially in the healthcare

industry

•Knowledge of statistical tools like PowerBI, tableau, R, machine learning

•Certified Healthcare Data Analyst (CHDA), optional

• eCW (eclinical works) Super User

title: JR.Data Analyst
description:
As the Data Analyst, you will be within the Data and Analytics organization, the Data and BI teams are undergoing a data modernization effort to create a modern enterprise data platform.

The Data Analyst will be a member of this transformation by working with a small team of business analysts and other data analysts to:
• Review and analyze the current legacy data platform and assist with the requirements of the new data platform from a BI, reporting, and analytic perspective.
• Analyze current legacy data and reporting, including KPIs and other metrics, to understand the new data platform requirements.
• Assess options for process improvement, including business process modeling.
• Create and maintain documentation around existing metrics, reports, and data mappings.
• Validate and QA the new data warehouse data to ensure it is able to be used effectively in the new semantic layer.

Knowledge Experience

Qualifications:
• 5 years experience as a Business Analyst
• 3 years experience using SQL to query and analyze data
• Ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with key stakeholders to support the creation of the semantic layer
• Experience testing and mapping various business processes, reporting, analytic use cases and databases
• Work with business directly, analyze requirements update mapping documents
• Strong Experience in Data Profiling, Data Analysis, and proficiency in creating Source to Target mapping document, writing and reviewing BRDs, FRDs, etc.
• Should be able to perform impact analysis for application changes
• Complete understanding of Software Development Life Cycle and Project implementation methodology
• Should take responsibilities tracking deliverable, taking ownership on deliverable in an onsite-offshore model and deliver on time
• Exposure to ETL and Data warehousing preferable
• Experience in any ETL Tool is mandatory
• Working knowledge of Power BI
• Ability to operate independently and successfully in a fast-paced environment
• Superior communication skills both oral and written
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, or related discipline

Preferred Experience:
• 5 years experience using SQL to query and analyze data
• Proficiency in Power BI or other reporting tools
• Proficient in version control and relational databases
• Master’s degree in computer science, statistics, or related discipline
• Mandatory Certificate: Certification in SQL

This is a 100% remote job.

title: Lead Data Analyst
description:
In this role, you’ll offer a strong data-driven perspective and have the opportunity to provide meaningful insights that are directly reflected in product and business decisions. Provide ad-hoc data analysis, deep dives, data visualizations, and statistical modeling. Lead a holistic approach towards defining KPIs for features and the overall business to develop and inform initiatives from a data-derived perspective. Partner closely with business owners to identify and evaluate strategic opportunities to drive growth for the company and increase engagement within the Headspace app. Collaborate with other members of the data science & analytics team, and the data engineering team to create a data-driven culture. Design A/B multivariate tests to drive product and growth improvements. Evaluate the impact of new product features on engagement and growth metrics.

Headspace is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: RESEARCH DATA ANALYST II
description:
Research Data Analyst II

Under the supervision of a Senior Transportation Surveyor, the incumbent serves as a District and Division support person possessing knowledge in the techniques and methodologies utilized in Geographic Information Systems (GIS). The incumbent performs work involving geospatial analysis and geospatial database management, and helps fulfill the Branch's responsibility for providing analytical data, output, and mapping using GIS and Computer Aided Design and Drafting (CADD) applications for various Caltrans project development, planning, asset management, maintenance, data storage and representation, and information delivery needs. The incumbent maintains working knowledge of GIS software and related technologies including desktop and on-line platforms. Incumbent will be assigned work based on Departmental needs. When using state owned vehicles, incumbents are required to have a valid driver's license.

PARF# 08-5-380 / JC-479518

Eligibility for hire may be determined by your score on the RESEARCH DATA ANALYST II exam. For those who do not have current eligibility (e.g., transfer, permissive reinstatement, or voluntary demotions) and/or who will be new to state civil services employment, you must be on the state examination list to be eligible for these positions. To apply for the exam, please click here and search by typing in the classification title.

The Human Resources Contact is available to answer questions regarding the application process. The Hiring Unit Contact is available to answer questions regarding the position.

Please take this 1-minute Caltrans Recruitment survey to tell us how you found out about this job.

https://forms.office.com/g/RyK102ty4G

https://youtu.be/oC9wIp8QalI

Apply today to join our team! We especially encourage applicants to check out our Caltrans Career Compass tool! The Caltrans Career Compass is a tool to assist and help candidates understand and succeed in applying to Caltrans positions.

Please visit either of the following two websites for a list of evaluation agencies: https://www.naces.org/members or https://aice-eval.org. Please redact birthdates and social security numbers.

Completed applications and all required documents must be received or postmarked by the Final Filing Date in order to be considered. Dates printed on Mobile Bar Codes, such as the Quick Response (QR) Codes available at the USPS, are not considered Postmark dates for the purpose of determining timely filing of an application.

Who May Apply

Individuals who are currently in the classification, eligible for lateral transfer, eligible for reinstatement, have list or LEAP eligibility, are in the process of obtaining list eligibility, or have SROA and/or Surplus eligibility (please attach your letter, if available). SROA and Surplus candidates are given priority; therefore, individuals with other eligibility may be considered in the event no SROA or Surplus candidates apply. Applications will be screened and only the most qualified applicants will be selected to move forward in the selection process.

title: Data Analyst - CA ONLY
description:
About the position

The Data Analyst position at Molina Healthcare is focused on designing and implementing processes and solutions that leverage a wide variety of data sets for data/text mining, analysis, modeling, and predictive analytics. This role is crucial for enabling informed business decisions within the Medicaid (Medi-Cal), Medicare, and Covered California lines of business. The Data Analyst will gain insights into key business problems and deliverables by applying statistical analysis techniques to examine both structured and unstructured data sourced from multiple disparate systems. Collaboration is a key aspect of this role, as the Data Analyst will work across departments and with customers to define requirements and understand business challenges. Utilizing advanced mathematical, statistical, querying, and reporting methods, the analyst will develop solutions that include information tools, algorithms, dashboards, and queries aimed at monitoring and improving business performance. The role encompasses the entire process from initial concept development to fully tested production solutions, with a strong emphasis on effectively communicating results to a diverse audience. The Data Analyst will also be expected to stay abreast of current and emerging technologies to enhance their work. Key responsibilities include extracting and compiling large data sets from various systems, setting up processes for monitoring and tracking department data, preparing state-mandated reports and analyses, and collaborating with internal and external clients to develop new standard reports or processes. The analyst will implement and utilize analytics software and systems to support departmental goals, ensuring that the organization meets its objectives efficiently and effectively.

Responsibilities
• Design and implement processes and solutions for data/text mining and analysis.
,
• Apply statistical analysis techniques to structured and unstructured data.
,
• Collaborate with departments and customers to define requirements and understand business problems.
,
• Develop information tools, algorithms, dashboards, and queries to monitor business performance.
,
• Create solutions from initial concept to fully tested production and communicate results to various audiences.
,
• Extract and compile large data sets from various systems to identify and analyze outliers.
,
• Set up processes for monitoring, tracking, and trending department data.
,
• Prepare state-mandated reports and analyses.
,
• Work with clients to research, develop, and document new standard reports or processes.
,
• Implement and use analytics software and systems to support departmental goals.

Requirements
• Associate's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
,
• 1-3 years of relevant experience in data analysis.

Nice-to-haves
• Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
,
• 3-5 years of healthcare experience.

Benefits
• Competitive benefits and compensation package.
,
• Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) M/F/D/V.

title: Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati is hiring: Data Analyst, CRM in Los Angeles
description:
Wilson Sonsini is the premier legal advisor to technology, life sciences, and other growth enterprises worldwide. We represent companies at every stage of development, from entrepreneurial start-ups to multibillion-dollar global corporations, as well as the venture firms, private equity firms, and investment banks that finance and advise them. The firm has approximately 1,100 attorneys in 18 offices: 13 in the U.S., three in China, and two in Europe. Our broad spectrum of practices and entrepreneurial spirit allow our staff exceptional opportunities for professional achievement and career growth.We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our Marketing Technology team. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing marketing data from multiple sources to support strategic initiatives, optimize campaigns, and ensure the firm’s business development and marketing efforts are on track. The role requires a strong blend of technical and analytical skills, along with the ability to collaborate across departments.Key Responsibilities:Ensure data accuracy and consistency across marketing technology platforms.Analyze data from various marketing technology platforms, including CRM systems, email marketing tools, social media analytics, and website traffic data.Assist in the design and implementation of data reporting dashboards for business development and leadership teams to track metrics around prospect client and client relationships.Provide in-depth analysis and recommendations based on data findings to optimize marketing and business development efforts around the firm’s client acquisition and retention strategies.Create insights around campaign performance, lead generation, and other key performance indicators (KPIs), within Marketo and Salesforce.Support the Senior Manager of Marketing Technology in the integration and automation of marketing data systems and tools.Present data-driven insights to stakeholders, including the business development, events, and communications teams.Create training documentation and how-to clips and provide user trainings as needed.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, or a related field.3+ years of experience in marketing data analysis, preferably within a law firm or professional services environment.Strong knowledge of data visualization and reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Excel, Smartsheet).Experience with CRM systems, ERM platforms, marketing automation tools (e.g., Salesforce, Marketo, Introhive), and Google Analytics.Familiarity with A/B testing, segmentation, and campaign optimization techniques.Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.The primary location for this job posting is in San Francisco, but other locations may be listed. The actual base pay offered will depend upon a variety of factors, including but not limited to the selected candidate’s qualifications, years of relevant experience, level of education, professional certifications and licenses, and work location. The anticipated pay range for this position is as follows:San Francisco and Silicon Valley: $81,600 - $110,400 per yearAustin, Boston, Boulder, District of Columbia, Los Angeles, New York, San Diego, Seattle, and Wilmington: $73,100 - $98,900 per yearSalt Lake City and all other locations: $65,450 - $88,550 per yearThe compensation for this position may include a discretionary year-end merit bonus based on performance. We offer a highly competitive salary and benefits package.Benefits information can be found here. Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).

title: Data Analyst (On-Site) - Now Hiring
description:
Extreme Music, formed in 1997, is renowned in the industry and around the world for its boundary-pushing approach to production music. Its A-list roster has yielded diverse award-winning collections and includes artists and composers such as Quincy Jones, Hans Zimmer, Sir George Martin, Snoop Dogg, Xzibit, and Junkie XL to name a few. Extreme's client and project list is a veritable who's who or what's what in the entertainment field working with all major networks and studios, ad agencies and production companies. Extreme Music is headquartered in London, with its creative operations based in a 7,500 square-foot production compound in Santa Monica, California. For more Extreme information visit www.extrememusic.com. Extreme Music is the Production Music House under Sony Music Publishing.

Why join Sony Music Group?

Here at Sony Music Group, we are shaping what's next in a way that creates impact. Forging powerful new ideas at the heart of music, technology, and culture that entertain and move people.

This is your opportunity. Part of a global community, united by individual passion, rising to that challenge every day. Adapting at pace and supporting one another, inspired to influence the future. For the benefit of you, our people; our creators, our business, and wider society too.

Be a part of an organization that is creator first. Committed to fueling excellence and always imagining more, while fostering a supportive culture, one where we elevate each other and act responsibly.

Job Purpose: You will answer questions about user behavior and product performance, ensuring data-driven decision-making that will shape which features, products, and services get pushed to (or maintained in) production. You'll use your own curiosity to formulate new questions and interrogate our data to deliver insights and recommendations.

What You'll Do: (job responsibilities)
• Create, measure, and document KPIs relevant to business needs and internal teams.
• Act as the main liaison between departments to ensure data accuracy and uniform understanding of key metrics, escalating issues as necessary to the development or implementation teams.
• On-demand analysis: evaluate and respond to questions from development, marketing, and sales teams to assist with their short- and long-term decision-making.
• Deep-dive analysis: study and visualize data to uncover trends and opportunities related to how users are interacting with our products.
• Maintain analytics systems: check for completeness, accuracy, and understandable lexicon, then oversee the implementation of any new data points or sources.
• Make informed predictions about user behavior-create, assess, and validate with A/B tests, then recommend changes based on findings.
• Create and maintain automated dashboards for non-technical users to promote self-service for common questions.
• Create marketing performance dashboards and review key metrics and findings with leadership and marketing teams.
• Centralize marketing measurement reporting and recommend performance optimizations.
• Perform reviews of live analytics platforms and ensure that they are meeting their stated goals.
• Work closely with the development teams to understand and anticipate their analytics needs.

Who You Are: (skills and experience required)
• Excellent communication, interpersonal, organizational, writing, and presentation skills.
• Excellent problem-solving skills.
• Excellent attention to detail with the ability to work at a fast pace, prioritize, and multitask without sacrificing quality.
• Ability to communicate technical ideas or problems succinctly and understandably to non-technical people.
• Naturally inquisitive and a strong drive to understand trends and underlying behaviors.
• College degree or equivalent.
• Familiarity with project management and documentation software.
• Strong experience using Mixpanel.
• Familiarity with common web and social tools like Google Analytics.
• Experience working with visualization and dashboarding tools like Power BI or Tableau.
• Strong desire to keep up to date with emerging technologies.
• Some Travel Required
• Must be authorized to work in the United States
• 7.5-hour business workday but variations in work volume frequently require extending working hours for evening and late-night events.

What We Give You:
• You join an inclusive, collaborative and global community where you have the opportunity to fuel the creative journey
• A modern office environment designed to foster productivity, creativity, and teamwork
• An attractive and comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life & disability coverage, and 401K + employer matching
• Voluntary benefits like company-paid identity theft protection and resources for pets, mental health and meditation resources, industry-leading fertility coverage, fully paid leave for childbirth or bonding, fully paid leave for caregivers, programs for loved ones with developmental disabilities and neurodiversity, subsidized back-up child and elder care, and reimbursement for adoption, surrogacy, tuition and student loans
• We invest in your professional growth & development
• Flexible Time Off
• Time off for a winter recess

DISCLAIMER: The anticipated annual base salary for this position is $60,000-$70,000. This range does not include any other compensation components or other benefits that an individual may be eligible for. The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.

SMP has good cause to conduct a background investigation because honesty, trustworthiness and ethical conduct are material requirements for the performance of the responsibilities of this position.

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, military status, status as a veteran or disabled veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or family status, genetic information, medical condition, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law, ordinance, or regulation.

EEO is the Law

EEO is the Law Supplement

• Voluntary benefits like company-paid identity theft protection and resources for pets, mental health and meditation resources, industry-leading fertility coverage, fully paid leave for childbirth or bonding, fully paid leave for caregivers, programs for loved ones with developmental disabilities and neurodiversity, subsidized back-up child and elder care, and reimbursement for adoption, surrogacy, tuition and student loans
• We invest in your professional growth & development
• Flexible Time Off
• Time off for a winter recess

This range does not include any other compensation components or other benefits that an individual may be eligible for. The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.

SMP has good cause to conduct a background investigation because honesty, trustworthiness and ethical conduct are material requirements for the performance of the responsibilities of this position.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
About VuMedi:VuMedi is a leading video education platform for healthcare professionals, offering expert-driven content across medical specialties. Our mission is to provide doctors with the most up-to-date, high-quality education to improve patient outcomes. We're growing rapidly and seeking a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team.

Position Summary:The Senior Analyst at VuMedi will play a key role in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. This position will be responsible for conducting complex data analyses, creating reports, and providing insights to support business operations, product development, and strategic initiatives. The Senior Analyst will work closely with various teams, including product, marketing, and finance, to ensure that data informs all aspects of decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:
• Data Analysis & Reporting: Analyze large datasets from multiple sources (internal platforms, web analytics, financial data) to identify trends, generate actionable insights, and produce regular and ad-hoc reports.
• Strategic Insights: Provide recommendations based on data analysis to support business growth, product enhancements, and user engagement strategies.
• Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product, sales, and operations, to understand their needs and provide data-driven insights.
• Dashboards & Visualization: Build and maintain dashboards and data visualization tools to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and track the success of various initiatives.
• Process Improvement: Identify areas for automation and efficiency improvements in data collection, processing, and analysis.
• Market Research: Conduct competitive analysis and market research to inform business strategy and development.
• Mentorship & Guidance: Act as a subject matter expert, providing mentorship and guidance to junior analysts and data teams.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in data science, statistics, economics, business analytics, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
• 4-6 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably in the healthcare, tech, or education industries.
• Proficiency with SQL, Python, R, or other analytical tools for data manipulation and analysis.
• Strong experience with data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
• Proven ability to handle and analyze large datasets, with excellent attention to detail.
• Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to synthesize complex data into clear, actionable insights.
• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Preferred Skills:
• Experience in the healthcare or medical education industry.
• Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud) for data storage and processing.
• Knowledge of A/B testing, predictive analytics, and statistical modeling.

title: Sr. Data Analyst
description:
Description

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who will provide critical support across the organization through advanced analytics that will capture real-time actionable data to guide decision making. In this role, you will be critical to our company’s growth. The primary responsibility of this position is to collect, analyze, and connect large volumes of data from disparate sources, extract insights, and identify opportunities to drive growth and improve profitability.

Requirements

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Integrate disparate sources of data and prepare high-level analyses using various software programs or statistical programming languages.
• Manage large, complex data sets and support the reporting requirements across the organization providing actionable and real-time data in a highly visual format (dashboards) to key stakeholders.
• Act as a data steward to maintain the integrity of our data sources within a centralized repository in which there is a “single source of data” to be referenced and ensure consistency in reporting across the organization.
• Collect and analyze data on consumer demographics, preferences, and purchasing trends across markets and sales channels to optimize product distribution and identify growth opportunities.
• Conduct competitive analyses across multiple sales channels providing insight into sales trends, effectiveness of various trade/marketing promotions, product pricing and distribution.
• Evaluate the Return on Investment (ROI) for marketing campaigns, both digital and in-store, and make recommendations on strategies that will drive profitable growth, improve our competitive position, and increase brand awareness.
• Work cross-functionally with Sales and Marketing teams in preparing retail presentations and creating fact-based selling stories.
• Work cross-functionally with Marketing and Innovation teams to analyze market and consumer insight data to inform new product development, packaging updates, and the development of go-to-market strategies.
• Develop new product forecasting models using predictive analytics and work closely with the Sales and Operations Planning Team to improve forecast accuracy for new product launches.
• Work collaboratively with internal team members in Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain and Demand Planning to refine customer forecasts for new and existing products.
• Assist in the development and refinement of channel, customer, and product P&Ls to drive profitable growth across multiple brand lines.
• Identify opportunities for process improvement that enable the organization to capture the most valuable data.
• Make recommendations for new KPIs and better ways to manage data to view the business across multiple dimensions.
• Conduct ad-hoc analyses and participate in other projects as needed.
• May be required to perform other duties as assigned or as needed.

Supervisory Responsibilities: This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree (B.A) in Business Analytics, Data Science, or Information Management, or related field or equivalent from a four-year university.
• 5+ years in an analyst role with experience in database management, KPI reporting, and marketing/promotional analytics or related experience and/or training in a Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) company.
• Experience in data warehousing and importing/exporting data to a variety of databases and applications.
• Experience in extracting and analyzing data from syndicated data platforms (e.g., Nielsen, IRI) and consumer insight data platforms (e.g., Numerator).
• Experience in using data visualization tools (e.g., Microsoft Power BI) is a plus.
• Experience with Microsoft Dynamics NAV (a.k.a. Navision) ERP software is a plus.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
• Advanced proficiency with software tools such as Excel and the ability to gather, assess, and analyze large volumes of data, as well as PowerPoint to build presentations.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy.
• Solid business intelligence and reporting development experience, preferably within a data lake environment.
• Exceptional team player with the interpersonal skills needed to work effectively in a cross-functional team setting, earn team confidence quickly, and facilitate change.
• Thrives in a fast-paced environment with the ability to manage multiple tasks and evolving priorities.
• Critical thinker and team player with the ability to inspire others to collaborate through own example.
• Strong people skills: able to work with a wide variety of personalities.
• Strong communication skills; persuasive, willing to share research and knowledge with the team.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands to finger, handle, and feel; reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, talk, and hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

This job description is subject to change at any time.

title: Data Analyst 1 - Remote Nationwide
description:
Collaborate and communicate. Collaborate with global team members to develop, deploy, and maintain BI tools and automated reporting. Communicate effectively to ensure alignment across all teams. Serve as a champion to Episource clients.

As Project Analytics Specialist, you will be responsible for vendor file updates and ongoing support. You will also train the client and other stakeholders on large-scale change orders as needed. You will act as a client subject matter expert. As a trusted advisor and subject matter expert, you will understand the business models of each operation, client, and project to deliver customized forecasts and revisions that support their goals. Showcase your meticulous eye for detail. Analyze, research, develop, and maintain project data for trend analysis and control. Investigate issues and cases to identify root causes and provide impact analysis for ongoing problems, changes, and requests for new functionality.

You'll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities:

Identify and address data quality issues, outliers and missing values
Perform exploration data analysis to uncover trends, patterns and relationships within datasets
Oversee ingestion pipelines and troubleshoots errors related to data. Resolve errors using approved data cleaning techniques
Translate complex data analysis into clear and actionable insights for stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for process optimization and strategic decision-making
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into operational efficiency, and other critical business performance metrics
Develops and maintains solid relationships with all internal and external stakeholders
Document analysis methodologies, assumptions and findings for future reference and replication
Requires an individual to maintain the ability to work in an environment with PHI / PII data

title: Data Analyst
description:
EPC Power is hiring a Data Analyst with 3 - 5 years of experience. Based in United States - Poway, CA and with In-office ways of working.

Job description and responsibilities:

We are seeking an experienced and versatile Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a vital role in leveraging data from SAP, Salesforce, Microsoft 365, and Google Workspace to generate valuable insights and drive data-informed decision-making across the organization. Additionally, you will be responsible for developing business automation processes, documenting processes and workflows, and organizing data, including document management. Your expertise in data analysis, visualization, process automation, and documentation will be instrumental in optimizing our business processes and supporting our growth.

Responsibilities
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and translate them into Power BI reports and dashboards.
• Extract, transform, and load data from various sources, including SAP, Salesforce, Microsoft 365, and Google Workspace, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
• Develop and maintain Power BI data models and visualizations that provide actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
• Conduct in-depth data analysis and interpretation to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for process automation and optimization.
• Design and implement data driven KPIs and metrics to measure performance and monitor progress towards organizational goals.
• Stay updated on the latest advancements in Power BI and data analytics to recommend and implement best practices for data visualization and reporting.
• Ensure data security and compliance by adhering to data governance policies and procedures.

Requirements and qualifications:

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
• Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably with expertise in Power BI and data analysis tools.
• Strong proficiency in creating visually appealing and interactive reports and dashboards using Power BI.
• Solid understanding of SAP, Salesforce, Microsoft 365, and Google Workspace, with experience extracting and analyzing data from these systems.
• Proficient in data modeling, data manipulation, and data visualization techniques.
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
• Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Continuous learning mindset with a keen interest in staying up to date with the latest advancements in data analytics and visualization.

Physical
• Ability to sit or stand for extended periods of time
• Ability to infrequently lift and/or move up to 35 pounds.

You will also enable personalization and customized behavior for our customers. You will be the bridge between product managers, data engineers, and marketing teams. You will drive requirements and data analysis and communicate them clearly to data engineers. You will also create user stories and test cases for quality assurance. title: Junior Analyst - Client Data Support
description:
We are global private markets specialists delivering tailored investment solutions, advisory services, and impactful, data driven insights to the world’s investors. Leveraging the power of our platform and our peerless intelligence across sectors, strategies, and geographies, we help identify the advantages and the answers our clients need to succeed.
Position Description

• For recent college graduates looking to gain exposure to the private markets industry, develop skills for investment analysis using business intelligence tools, and work towards potential full time career opportunities with StepStone.
• Junior Analysts will have the opportunity to develop an understanding of financial markets and data analysis by working closely with various internal teams and assisting in ad-hoc client deliverable efforts.
• Opportunity to work with and contribute to the StepStone’s Portfolio Analytics and Reporting (“SPAR”) team supporting Client Data Services operations located in La Jolla, CA.
• Full-time (40 hours per week) opportunity for a 16-week period with the possibility to extend or to transition to a permanent role.

Essential Job Functions

• Use performance reporting systems and analytics dashboard tools (e.g., Power BI, SQL, Power Pivot) to compile accurate and timely analysis for external clients
• Actively collaborate with various SPAR Client Teams to obtain all necessary information required for completion of ad-hoc deliverables, compiling final information in a manner consistent with SPAR’s global reporting master template standards
• Assist in execution and oversight of the full lifecycle of periodic reporting processes, ensuring proper data practices and methodologies are applied
• Remain organized while adjusting to competing demands, aiming to beat rather than meet deadlines
• Assist in developing and maintaining new and enhanced data-related content for client deliverables
• Develop a deep understanding of reporting tools, industry best practices and proprietary reporting systems
• Must be curious, willing to innovate and can create novel approaches on a day-to-day basis

Education and/or Work Experience Requirements

• Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics or accounting related field preferred
• Prior experience with the use of data analysis and performance reporting
• Record of accomplishment of projects demonstrating value-add initiatives

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

• Experience with performance reporting software and business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Excel, Power Pivot, SQL and Tabular Models
• Extremely strong attention to detail
• Strong time management, prioritization, and communication skills
• Highly motivated self-starter, with demonstrated history of taking initiative, being adaptive in a fast-changing environment, and working independently
• Inquisitive and intellectually curious, able to independently learn recent technologies, skills, and industry standards

Salary: $27.50 / hour

At StepStone, we believe that our people are our most important asset and crucial to our success. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that strives to create an environment that empowers our employees and allows them to be heard, regardless of title or tenure. Our organizational community features multiple Employment Resource Groups as well as mentorship programs to enhance the employee experience for all.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, StepStone does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.
Developing People at StepStone

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
SR. DATA ANALYST, BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE

Z SUPPLY is an established California women’s lifestyle brand that is leading the space for casual, comfortable style. Located in the heart of Orange County, we are passionate about staying true to our roots and living a life of good vibes in and out of the office. Our culture is collaborative, fast-paced, and team oriented. We are inspired by our creative mission, engaged in our everyday work, and enjoy partnering with our teammates and customers.

We are currently seeking a Sr. Data Analyst, Business Intelligence who has a deep understanding of the fashion and apparel industry and is a master of data science methodologies. This role will be critical in leveraging data to generate actionable insights that support key strategic decisions. This individual will be a central, Sr. Data Analyst for the company, providing reporting & analysis that supports finance, e-commerce, wholesale, buying and other departments as needed.

Position Type: Full Time / Salary Exempt

Reporting To: VP of Ecommerce

Location: Z SUPPLY Headquarters - Costa Mesa, CA

Work Type : Hybrid Position - Partial In Office 3-4 Days / Partial Remote 1-2 days

POSITION DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES
• Create and maintain analytical reports that guide e-commerce and wholesale business strategies.
• Automate and streamline data analysis workflows.
• Utilize data to derive actionable insights in areas such as customer retention, customer segmentation, and product return rates.
• Reconcile and distribute weekly/monthly reports for finance, e-commerce and other departments as needed.
• Manage end-to-end data analysis tasks, including data extraction, cleaning, analysis, and interpretation.
• Create & maintain intuitive dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align business objectives with data analysis.
• Stay informed about the latest trends, technologies, and methodologies in the data science field and the fashion and apparel industry.

QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE / REQUIRED SKILLS / COMPETENCIES
• Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or related field
• A minimum of 7-10+ years of experience as a Sr. Data Analyst, preferably within the fashion and apparel industry.
• Strong Tableau experience required.
• Proficiency with other data visualization tools such as Google Analytics, Looker (Data Studio), etc.
• Must have exceptional communication skills (both written and oral). Able to simplify complex data.
• Experience in statistical programming languages such as R or Python is preferred.
• Experience with SQL and familiarity with database management. AWS or Shopify experience is a plus.
• Fluent in AI. Ability to interpret outputs from machine learning and AI systems and convert them into strategic insights.
• Advanced understanding of data science methodologies, including but not limited to:
• Data collection and cleaning: Experience with various data collection methodologies and the capacity to clean and standardize data for analysis.
• Statistical analysis: Capability to interpret and analyze data using statistical techniques and deliver ongoing reports.
• Data mining: Knowledge of data mining techniques to extract significant insights from large datasets.
• Predictive modeling and analytics: Experience with predictive models and analytics to anticipate trends and business outcomes.
• Machine Learning experience is a plus.
• Comprehensive understanding of various department level reporting including, but not limited to: Finance, Operations, Logistics, Ecommerce, Wholesale, Buying and Planning.
• Self-starter and curious mindset.
• High attention to detail and accuracy.
• Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
• Other tasks as assigned.
• Must be able to legally work in the U.S. without restriction or sponsorship.

TYPICAL WORKING CONDITIONS / EQUIPMENT USED / PHYSICAL TASKS
• Office / Desk Workstation
• Air Conditioned
• Computer / Laptop / Standard Office Equipment
• Frequent use of hands with computers typing / dexterity
• Occasional twisting while moving product / computer workstation

Z SUPPLY PERKS

At Z SUPPLY, departments work cross-functionally enabling individuals to further their knowledge and expertise in an inclusive and supportive environment. In addition to a collaborative and supportive culture, here are a few additional perks that are enjoyed by the Z SUPPLY team:
• Hybrid partial remote/in-office work schedule
• Half-day Friday’s year round
• Generous clothing discount
• Comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage
• 401K with discretionary annual company match
• New chic and modern offices located near top restaurants and shopping.
• Positive, collaborative company culture.

SALARY RANGE

$90,000-$125,000 Annually

As required by applicable Pay Transparency laws, Z SUPPLY provides a range of compensation for roles that may be hired in locations under these requirements. To determine starting pay within the hiring range, we carefully consider a variety of factors, including primary work location, role/level, a candidate’s skills, experience, market demands, internal parity and other relevant factors. Flexibility outside of the salary range listed may be considered based on additional skills or qualifications a candidate may possess that may justify additional compensation. Company paid health benefits, PTO, bonus and other various company perks are not included in the salary range listed above and are considered additional compensation.

Want to join our amazing growing team? Apply today!

We hope we get the chance to work with you!

title: Principal Call Center Data Analyst
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Anywhere

Americor is seeking Principal Call Center Data Analyst to join our team. Specific job title and offer to align to the qualifications of the candidate.

Compensation: $120,000-$150,000 annually, dependent on experience.

Work Location: Remote / Hybrid - Irvine, CA.

About Us:

Americor is a leading provider of debt relief solutions for people of all backgrounds. We offer various services to help our clients achieve financial freedom, including debt consolidation loans, debt settlement, and credit repair. Our dedication to others sets us apart – not only as a company but as a community of employees who support each other’s personal and professional growth. Recognized as a ‘Top Place to Work’ and ‘Best Company’ for our outstanding service and commitment to excellence.

Essential Job Functions:
• Primary owner of telephony and workforce management data from Five9, Zoom, and Calabrio to be used for reporting and analysis.
• Demonstrate deep understanding of telephony and workforce management performance, underlying data, as well as call forecasting, routing, and delivery.
• Maintain existing telephony data semantic layers and continue to improve data that is available.
• Create workforce management data semantic layers using disciplined principles and practices.
• Monitor and derive intraday insights to operations leadership on telephony and workforce management.
• Provide a positive or negative alarm when operations change from the expected trajectory.
• Identify cohorts and underlying drivers that are affecting metrics and call performance.
• Initiate and own audits to remove defects, apply standardized practices, and reinforce best methods for telephony and workforce management data.
• Complete ad hoc analysis and reporting on the data for key stakeholders.
• Reporting should be designed in a diagnostic manner and be simple to use.
• Analysis should exhibit concise storytelling with clear insights and recommendations.
• Other duties as assigned.

Education and Experience Requirements:
• Telephony and workforce management experience required; Five9, Zoom, Calabrio, and telephony administration preferred.
• Advanced proficiency with SQL.
• Intermediate proficiency with a programming language; Advanced Python preferred.
• Intermediate proficiency with a visualization platform; Advanced Tableau preferred.
• Proven ability to position oneself to advise and teach across a matrixed organization.
• Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
• Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field or equivalent experience.

Company Benefits:
• Ongoing training and development
• Opportunity for career advancement
• Medical
• Dental
• Vision
• Company Paid Group Life / AD&D Insurance
• 7 Paid Holidays and 2 Floating Holiday Days to use at will
• Paid Time Off
• Flexible Spending/HSA
• Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
• 401(k) match
• Referral Program

Americor is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Americor does not discriminate based on race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law.
• Note to Agencies: Americor Funding, Inc. (the “Company”) has an internal recruiting department. Americor Funding Inc. may supplement that internal capability from time to time with assistance from temporary staffing agencies, placement services, and professional recruiters (“Agency”). Agencies are hereby specifically directed NOT to contact Americor Funding Inc. employees directly in an attempt to present candidates. The Company’s policy is for the internal recruiting team or other authorized personnel to present ALL candidates to hiring managers. Any unsolicited resumes sent to Americor Funding Inc. from a third party, such as an Agency, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Company mailing address, fax machine, or email address, directly to Company employees, or to the resume database, will be considered Company property. Americor Funding Inc. will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Americor Funding Inc. will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees.

title: M&A Data Analyst
description:
Support the M&A People team during due diligence, integration planning & execution. Own the data management workstream during M&A projects with a focus on data integrity, analysis and reporting. Establish data change management processes and policies to ensure the integrity of the people data as well as the security of sensitive people data. Ensure acquired company data is managed consistently and in compliance with local and regional processes and policies. Apply your analytics expertise to develop M&A insights and help advise, influence and support the design and management of M&A processes & operations from end-to-end. Leverage enablers like process optimization, automation etc. to find the appropriate balance between operational efficiency and cost optimization. Diagnose operational breakdowns at the root cause and work with key partners to find efficient and holistic solutions. Produce ad hoc analyses with quick turnarounds based on business requests. Own regular acquired employee attrition reporting and other M&A success metrics on all deals.

Uber is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Sr. Business Data Analyst
description:
Overview

Sr. Business Data Analyst

Position Summary: Are you excited to analyze large datasets and help business owners make data driven decisions in the Mortgage Industry? Are you excited to design and develop automated reports using industry leading tools like Power BI? At New American Funding we know the importance of utilizing quantitate insights and actionable reports to drive our business; and we are looking for a highly talented Business Data Analyst to join our BI and Analytics team and help us become a more data driven company.

Location: Remote/ Hybrid two days a week if you reside within 30 miles of Tustin, CA or a local Branch.

Starting Salary $90-130K

Responsibilities

Duties and Responsibilities:
• Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive stakeholder engagement in Operations.
• Extensive experience in building Power BI Dashboards using Complex DAX Functions / merging multiple data sets/data sources.
• Strong SQL skills in analyzing, implementing/writing complex SQL scripts for designing critical data sets, trace data quality issues and should be proficient in data cleansing.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
• Possess the ability to identify, analyze and resolve problems logically and systematically.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to present complex information in an easy-to-understand manner with clear recommendations based on data insight.
• Can function collaboratively as part of a fast-paced, customer-oriented team, perform effectively and demonstrate willingness to support the team on all levels to get the job done.
• Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast-paced environment.
• Experience in engaging with various levels of business leadership, managing and communicating work items
• Experience in presenting analytical finding and dashboards to business leadership with clear communication
• Other duties may be assigned.

Qualifications

Qualifications:
• Experience independently designing and implementing solutions to complex problems.
• Have attention to detail to ensure the highest level of quality/rigor in solutions.
• Must have mortgage industry experience.
• Must have clear and effective communication.
• Strong SQL experience.
• Strong experience in Visualization tools like Power BI to create clean, visually compelling charts that will help understand discoveries and empower others to use data to make key decisions.
• Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analysis, dashboards, etc. to drive stakeholder engagement.
• Attention to details that involve reading/accessing intricate coding or technical structure.
• Understanding of the mortgage industry including the life cycle of a loan.

Desired Education/Experience:
• Bachelor's degree in business, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related field preferred.
• Experience working with Power BI.
• 3+ years of experience as a Business Data Analyst, Data Engineer or equivalent.
• Highly prefer understanding of Operations teams in Mortgages
• Relevant experience as a business analyst, data analyst or related role is a plus.
• Working knowledge of SQL and creating complex queries.
• Experience with Snowflake.

#Remote

title: Data Analyst Manager
description:
About the position

At Sedgwick, we prioritize taking care of our colleagues, which is reflected in our culture of caring. As a Data Analyst Manager, you will play a crucial role in managing a team of data analysts, developing complex reports, and analyzing both corporate and client-specific data. This position requires you to serve as a technical resource for company staff on data analysis and benchmarking issues, ensuring that our clients receive the highest level of service. You will be responsible for meeting with clients to discuss their data needs and providing training and education on data analysis for program staff. Additionally, you will provide technical oversight and guidance to client-dedicated analysts located in multiple field offices, ensuring that all data analysis functions meet the specific needs of our clients and senior management. Your primary responsibilities will include managing the workflow and project assignments of your team, developing comprehensive and accurate information reports, including OSHA reporting for specific clients, and creating complex data reports for forecasting and benchmarking purposes. You will report directly to senior management, communicating your findings and insights to help guide decision-making processes. Your role will also involve obtaining, analyzing, and providing feedback on company or client-specific information needs, serving as a resource for colleagues on data analysis and benchmarking issues, and providing training and education to enhance the skills of your team. In addition to your essential functions, you will support the organization's quality programs and perform other duties as assigned. This position requires a strong commitment to leadership, as you will administer company personnel policies, conduct interviews, and establish performance development plans for your colleagues. Your ability to provide support, guidance, and motivation will be key to promoting maximum performance within your team.

Responsibilities
• Manage a staff of data analysts including project assignment and workflow.
,
• Develop comprehensive, complex, and accurate information reports including OSHA reporting for a specific client.
,
• Create complex data reports and provide analysis for forecasting and/or benchmarking used by senior management.
,
• Report directly to senior management and communicate data findings for forecasting and client needs.
,
• Obtain, analyze, and provide appropriate feedback on company or client specific information needs.
,
• Provide complex data analysis functions to meet client specific, program or company senior management needs.
,
• Serve as a resource for colleagues on data analysis and benchmarking issues.
,
• Provide technical oversight and guidance to client dedicated analysts located in multiple field offices.
,
• Provide training and data analysis education for colleagues.

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree with major in Business Administration, Statistics, or Quantitative Analysis from an accredited college or university preferred.
,
• Eight (8) years of related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience required, including four (4) years business experience in an insurance related field and four (4) years statistical analysis required.
,
• Supervisory experience preferred.
,
• Knowledge of risk management information systems including utilization and functionality.
,
• Excellent oral and written communication, including presentation skills.
,
• PC literate, including Microsoft Office products.
,
• Analytical and interpretive skills.
,
• Strong organizational skills.
,
• Strong time management skills.
,
• Excellent interpersonal skills.
,
• Excellent negotiation skills.
,
• Ability to work in a team environment.
,
• Ability to meet or exceed Performance Competencies.

Nice-to-haves

Benefits
• Flexible work hours
,
• Support for mental, physical, financial, and professional needs
,
• Opportunities for career growth and skill sharpening
,
• Diversity and inclusion initiatives
,
• Employee recognition programs
